title: Swipe gesture typing accuracy improvements
body:
I've started using the beta channel to test this feature and the main issue I've found is one of accuracy. 

Trying to gesture type this title I end up with: "Setoff gesturer toping accuracy improvements". 

For the most part prediction doesn't seem to take into account likely next words and often chooses uncommon words compared to the other potential words which have the same gesture pattern (eg always getting "tressed" instead of "test"). 

I'm also not sure if this feature learns and improves for each user over time, but for the short time I've tested it repeatedly doing the same words I haven't found a discernible improvement.

title: Backspace after space doubles first character of previous word
body:
### NOTE
This is what is described in issue #1323, but that is marked as closed, and I just installed ASK from GPS and it has this problem, so I figured I might get more views by making it a new issue. Sorry for any inconvenience, but it's driving me nuts, months after that issue was closed!

### Steps to reproduce
1. type a word, or part of a word. For example, I am trying to type and, but type ans
2. Add a space after the word, ie ans .
3. Backspace that space, and the first letter of the word gets doubled: aans

### Expected behaviour
When typing a word, hitting space, and then backspacing, I don't see any reason to ever double the first letter of the word. I would expect nothing to happen! (Note, this does not happen with Show Suggestions turned off).

### Actual behaviour
The first letter of the word is doubled, and auto-correct seems to forget about the double letter, and will auto-correct the complete word after the doubled letter(s) at the beginning. This makes me backspace the entire word or move cursor to the doubled letter(s) at the beginning to fix that word.

**Android OS version:**
Android 8.1.0, Build M1AJQ.N960USQS1ARH6

**Device manufacturer and model:**
Samsung Galaxy Note9, SM-N960U

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
N/A, just the English that ASK came with. No themes besides stock Samsung on Android.

title: Japanese keyboard development
body:
I'm making a Japanese language pack, I would like to know if it's possible to include an additional layout accessible via the top row, like when accessing the symbols keyboard through the top row. Using this idea, when having a hiragana keyboard (the basic Japanese "alphabet", correctly known as syllabary) based on the user may want to type a word or two in katakana (the syllabary for foreign words) without having to go through the hassle of changing to a completely different layout. Popup and multi-tap keys can be used with the Japanese Industrial Standards layout (basically a qwerty mode), but are not an interesting option with a 12-key layout (keitai mode) because the mix would be confusing as there would be more than 15 characters per key in some cases. Just a thought, a layout exclusively for katakana is possible, but not interesting in terms of productivity. It goes a little bit towards these two issue requests: https://github.com/AnySoftKeyboard/AnySoftKeyboard/issues/923 https://github.com/AnySoftKeyboard/AnySoftKeyboard/issues/1390
![screenshot_2018-10-04-23-21-40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29080542/46512962-c2f8c680-c82c-11e8-975b-baaf4199927c.png)

Thanks for any help, I will keep the work and have the pack fully set very very soon.

title: Make the method of setting the priority of keyboards more explicit
body:
For a good while I thought there's no way to set which language/layout should be the default out of the enabled ones. Thought (and experienced) that it always takes QWERTY English as default.

Then I realized that in "Language" -> "Enable keyboards and languages", keyboards can be dragged if they are long-tapped, and their order can be changed. This makes me assume that the order set up there sets the priority, so that if I drag Keyboard X to the first spot (and Keyboard X is enabled), it will treat X as the default, and my preference doesn't have to be changed manually in every app. Am I correct in assuming this?

If yes, then the process by which the priority is set should be made more explicit. Probably a different method should be devised.

1. It is not obvious that you can enable/disable keyboards by tapping on them.
2. But more importantly, it's not obvious *at all* that you can drag keyboards on the list, change their position and that their position determines the priority of keyboards, and with that, the default keyboard used all over the system.

For point 1, I propose having an empty checkbox for disabled keyboards, to communicates that the keyboards in question can be enabled. I further propose making the preview image of the disabled keyboards more transparent and/or grayscale to emphasize that keyboards can be enabled and disabled.

For point 2, which is the greater potential source of confusion, I propose abandoning the present dragging system and devising another way to set priority. For example, you could make another menu in "Language" which explicitly states that you can set the priority there by dragging. In that menu, keyboards would appear only by name in one line, items could be dragged, and each item would have the "dragging symbol" (three parallel horizontal lines) flushed to the right side of the box to make usage clearer. You could also have disabled keyboards there, so priority won't be lost when disabling/enabling keyboards,  but disabled keyboards should be displayed in a different way (e.g. in gray color).

title: Lack of documentation on Alt+Space language switch shortcut logic
body:
This issue is in reference to the `isAltSpaceLangSwitchNotPossible` method defined [here](https://github.com/AnySoftKeyboard/AnySoftKeyboard/blob/c7f8c2142664736ca1059a18e179468ed5ba4bb9/app/src/main/java/com/anysoftkeyboard/utils/Workarounds.java#L37) and used [here](https://github.com/AnySoftKeyboard/AnySoftKeyboard/blob/c7f8c2142664736ca1059a18e179468ed5ba4bb9/app/src/main/java/com/anysoftkeyboard/ime/AnySoftKeyboardHardware.java#L138).

What is the rationale behind the model check? I couldn't find anything online documenting limitations of that shortcut as it pertains to language-switching, nor any justification as to why those model strings in particular were selected.

#1465 adds a configuration option for toggling an existing Shift+Space language switch shortcut, which would be useful to add for the Alt+Space shortcut as well. It's unclear how this logic might affect the setting description, and it's preferable not to clutter extra config options on devices where they're not relevant. Ideally, it would be possible to add a comment with these details in the code as well.

title: Indonesian languange pronouns: design discussion
body:
Indonesian language pronouns doesn't use white space

| id | en
--- | --- |
buku*mu* | your book
pensil*nya* | his pencil

English pronouns separated with white space. It's easy to store them in
separated word value (in dictionary). Indonesian pronouns are
combined, so ASK will always store it in dictionary, because ASK
thinks that they are new words. This will make our dictionary full of
the same meaning word just with additional pronouns.

What your opinion on this ?

Can we tell ASK in indonesian-mode that those words are just pronouns
? (expanded from base word)

- - - 

Watching [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0j74jcxSunY)
video. It's hard to design our app to support all languages
style. Maybe for now, the easiest way is to store all those words as
new word. Also because I see that Indonesian Language has lot of pronouns,
additions, prefixes, suffixes. oh no :)

Thanks for ASK

title: More Colemak & Workman Improvements
body:
I fixed a minor spacing issue with the shift and backspace keys. Then I added punctuation keys to the popup characters, and gave them hintlabels.

I'm still confused about how to update the changelog but I think all my contributions this week can be boiled down to 3 main bullet points:

* Added Workman English layout.
* Added Terminal common top row, for using terminal keys with any layout.
* Added more long press characters to the Colemak layout.

title: Add terminal common top row
body:
Adds a terminal common top row, for terminal use with non-QWERTY layouts, or for people who prefer these keys on top.

See #1443.

title: Punctuation keys are not shifted in Dvorak, Colemak, Workman, or possibly others
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Switch layout to Dvorak, Colemak, or Workman.
2. Shift into uppercase.

### Expected behaviour
Punctuation should shift along with the alphabetic characters. `'`, `,`, `.`, and `;` should become `"`, `<`, `>`, and `:`. The keyboard XML files seem to describe what should happen, but that information is ignored.

### Actual behaviour
The keys stay the same as when they were unshifted.

**Android OS version:** LineageOS 15.1

**Device manufacturer and model:** Google Pixel (sailfish)

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**

title: Add popup characters to Colemak and Workman
body: Add popup characters to Colemak and Workman, as discussed in #1452. Mainly for the sake of accessing the digits, but I also included everything found in the QWERTY layout.

title: Should punctuation keys really be included in the alternative English layouts?
body:
QWERTY doesn't include any punctuation keys in the "main" layout, but Dvorak, Colemak, and my recent Workman PR do. Should these be removed to reduce clutter or do people use them?

Dvorak might need them to keep the top row keys over to the right, but I think it is probably safe to remove the (semi-)colon key from Colemak and Workman. What do you think?

Maybe it is important to have 10 keys in the top row, so that you can long press them to get 1234567890, but right now you can't do that in Colemak or Workman any way.

title: Delete word while gesture typing
body:
It seems that ASK will get gesture typing soon. I'm quite excited for this upcoming feature. As gesture typing ifs not always the most accurate way to type, it is frequently necessary to remove the most recently added word. Currently that requires removing the entire word character by character. Google's implementation allows the user to instantly remove the most recent word by hitting the backspace key once. I feel this could greatly improve gesture typing speed. 
PS: this post was gesture typed using ASK.

_Sent from my Galaxy S5 using [FastHub-Libre](https://github.com/thermatk/FastHub-Libre/)_

title: Cannot switch to second language via pop-up menu
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install `ASK` (1.9.2055) and `ASK: German` (2.0.4) from F-Droid.
2.Enable keyboards `German broad+` and `English` and drag the `German` keyboard to the first place in the list.
3. Select `No top row`.
4. Select `Old school` bottom row.
5. Put the focus in a text field.
6. Swipe left on the space key and press the cogwheel or long press ENTER key to get the pop-up menu.
7. Select `Change input method`.
8. Check `English: AnySoftKeyboard`.
    a. The keyboard switches to English and `English` is shown in the space bar.
    b. The type-ahead feature switches to English.
9. Repeat 6. and 7.
10. But now check `German: AnySoftKeyboard`.
    a. **The keyboard does not switch to German.**
    b. The type-ahead feature switches to German.
11. If I use the world symbol key from the keyboard to switch between English and German, the switch is successful.

### Expected behaviour
The keyboard layout should switch both ways: From German to English and back from English to German when using the pop-up menu accessible through long-pressing the ENTER key.

### Actual behaviour
The keyboard does not switch from English to German when using the pop-up menu accessible through long-pressing the ENTER key.

It does change when using the world symbol key though.

**Android OS version:**
7.0

**Device manufacturer and model:**
Unihertz, Jelly Pro

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
- `ASK: German` (2.0.4) from F-Droid.

After upgrading to version 1.9.2055 the "Sound on key-press" feature is misbehaving.

title: [Feature request] Custom, language-specific top/bottom rows & symbol layouts
body:
Would it be possible to include language-specific, additional custom top/bottom rows in language packs? These should be switchable from AnySoftKeyboard's UI settings, where the built-in rows are listed.

I'm asking this because I would like to have a more refined bottom row layout with some specific symbols. However, this row layout would only be useful and work well with a specific language, so adding these in ASK's default bottom rows would not make sense. I'm aware that it's possible to specify a bottom row in the `keyboards.xml` of the LanguagePack template, but this means that the user can't then change the bottom row from the ASK settings because the language pack is overriding it.

The same goes for the built-in symbol layout. Different languages have different conventions and use different symbols. It would be the best to have language-specific symbol layouts defined in the language packs. It's rather cumbersome to cram all the possible symbols used in a language to the standard letter layout (even with pop-ups).

title: Configuration: allow disregarding layout's top and bottom rows (and use the generic ones)
body:
﻿### Steps to reproduce
This happens with the beta version of AnySoftKeyboard, too, but it's more noticeable when installing the NEO layout.

1. Install from F-Droid AnySoftKeyboard 1.9r-1, and ASK's NEO2 and Spanish layouts
2. Search for the AnySoftKeyboard application in the app drawer (or use any other method to open ASK's configuration screen).
3. Tap Language > Enable keyboard and layouts, disable default English keyboards, and enable only NEO and a Spanish layout.
4. Tap UI, and a keyboard will appear on screen.
5. Tap Tweaks and more, and choose a different Common bottom generic row. Press the Back key, and tap again the UI button.
6. The exact same keyboard appears on screen.

### Expected behaviour
There should be a way to choose which keyboard is displayed on steps 4 and 6, or it should default to the one I'm using now.

### Actual behaviour
The displayed keyboard is always NEO2.

If I install different add-ons, or enable/disable different keyboards, the keyboard in steps 4 and 6 is always the enabled keyboard in step 3 that's nearest to the top.

This is more noticeable when using NEO2's keyboard in F-Droid because the bottom row of that keyboard is fixed: it doesn't change when choosing a different common bottom generic row.

**Android OS version:** Android KitKat 4.4, Google services disabled

**Device manufacturer and model:** Vodafone Turbo 4 Smart

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):** This happens with any number of ASK's add-ons, in 1.9r-1 and the current (30 May 2018) beta version.

title: Settings Sliders Enhancing
body: When changing a value in a slider (say, volume or vibration) a feedback is given with the new slider value.

title: Character request: guillemets, and non-breaking space
body:
Standard Spanish uses guillemets («») as primary quotation marks, and some other languages (French?) do.

Could you add these in the symbols keyboard, for all languages? Their codepoints are:

* `«` U+00AB LEFT-POINTING DOUBLE ANGLE QUOTATION MARK, under keys `"` and `<`
* `»` U+00BB RIGHT-POINTING DOUBLE ANGLE QUOTATION MARK, under keys `"` and `>`

and maybe:
* `‹` U+2039 SINGLE LEFT-POINTING ANGLE QUOTATION MARK, under keys `<`, and either `'` or `"`?
* `›` U+203A SINGLE RIGHT-POINTING ANGLE QUOTATION MARK, under keys `>`, and either `'` or `"`?
* ` ` U+00A0 NO-BREAK SPACE

**Android OS version:** Android KitKat 4.4.4.

**Device manufacturer and model:** Vodafone Smart 4 Turbo (that's the actual model name, it's apparently a rebranding of a Qualcomm/Yulong chinese cheap model)

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):** AnySoftKeyboard (Beta), and Spanish for AnySoftKeyboard.

title: Fix swapped shift and backspace on colemak layout
body:
ASK's Colemak layout swaps shift and backspace, as noted in issue #998 . This swapped layout does not match the backspace key positioning on the number and symbol input pages, leading to much annoyance.

This PR simply swaps them back to match the symbols page, and all other keyboards.

~The official colemak keyboard layout (colemak.com) does not move the backspace key at all, it is in the default position on the keyboard.~ Actually colemak recommends remapping capslock to backspace, but on an android keyboard this doesn't make much sense.

title: Allow adjusting emoji gender and skin tone
[Feature Request] Support for Image / GIF insertion
body:
As in https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/text/image-keyboard

There are two ways I could see this working:
- A button on the keyboard launches the default gallery picker, and inserts the selected image into the text view on return. This is intrusive in terms of interface, but doesn't require extra permissions.
- A gallery is shown _within_ the keyboard*, and inserts the image into the text view on tap.

*from user-selected folders, as an extension

I can potentially work on this feature over the coming months, but I would like to hear if it's desirable with the overall project as is, and if so, which direction (or any other) would be best to go with.

title: The French preposition « à » is not suggested by default and cannot be added to the suggestions list
body:
In French, the preposition `à` is very often used in daily conversations. With current version of the French language pack, it is annoying to type and cannot be saved by touching it.

It should be a default suggestion or, at least, should allow the user to add it to the suggestions.

### Steps to reproduce

Theme: `Plain dark theme`
Common top generic row: `No top row`
Common bottom generic row: `Simple`

#### Test 1
1. Select `FR - Qwerty`
2. Type `a`

#### Test 2
1. Select `FR - Qwerty`
2. Long press `a`
3. Select `à`
4. Try typing the `à` that is displayed in the suggestion line (next to the `← Touch again to save`)

### Expected behaviour
#### Test 1
Both `a` and `à` should be proposed by default, since `à` is such an important locution in French

#### Test 2
I should be able to press `à`, and it would be saved as a suggestion for later use.

### Actual behaviour
#### Test 1
I currently have two suggestions proposed: `a` and `aller`

#### Test 2
`à` is greyed out and cannot be selected:

![keyboard-qwerty-fr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/512471/39414740-b7412610-4c6d-11e8-94eb-f338c54ee52e.jpg)


**Android OS version:**
7.0

**Device manufacturer and model:**
Samsung Galaxy S7 (SM-G935FD)

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
- ASK v1.9.1117 from F-Droid
- ASK French Language Pack v1.0.67 from F-Droid

title: Not remembering most saved words, cannot save new words since the last update (v1.9-r2).
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Type saved or unsaved word (not remembered)
2. Touch word to save it
3. "Touch again to save" not responsive to touch

### Expected behaviour
Until the previous update I would add words to the dictionary as per the usual method, and then the app would remember them and not autocorrect (ie "lol" would not be autocorrected to "mol" after I'd added "lol" to the dictionary).

### Actual behaviour
Since the update two issues have arisen. The first is that (despite still appearing in the dictionary in the app itself) the keyboard does not remember most or all saved words (cannot confirm if it is all of them, but it has been a large number of confirmed saved words).

When I attempt to add/re-add a word to the dictionary list the "Touch again to save" prompt is unresponsive. No matter how many times it has been attempted it no longer saves words.

When I opened the dictionary to see if the words had all been erased, they were all present. For a brief period the keyboard returned to correctly remembering the words, before reverting once again to having forgotten all of them (over the course of all of this, however, I have been unable to add new saved words).

**Android OS version:** 7.1.1

**Device manufacturer and model:** Motorolla Moto E4 Plus

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):** Lean Dark stock theme used, English QWERTY Latin stock kebyoard used (no other add-ons)

title: Improve capitalization in next word suggestion
body:
Currently (I'm running v1.9.1117 from F-Droid), the behavior is to always suggest lower-case words, even if I've always typed a certain combination with mixed case. For example, I always type 'Lajpat Nagar', but the suggestion after typing 'Lajpat' is always 'nagar' (lowercase). Typing 'N' makes the suggestion vanish, and I have to type around four letters till it appears again, to get something I should have gotten with just one tap 🙂

I can think of two possible solutions for this -
1. Control the capitalization of the next word suggestion with the Shift key. That is, if I type 'Lajpat' and 'nagar' is suggested, tapping Shift should make the suggestion 'Nagar', and tapping Shift again should change it back to lowercase. Double-tapping Shift could capitalize either the first letter ('Foo', as above) or all letters ('FOO') of all suggestions (until Shift is tapped again).
2. Let the next word information be stored case-sensitively.

title: [Feature Request] Emoji screen as a long press alternative on the return or Numeric Key
body:
### Details
While there are alternative keypad layouts  that have both the emoji and numeric buttons, I prefer the Alternate(no mic) layout. 
Swiping to get to the numeric keypad is sometimes a hit and miss option when using one handed, and it also cuts into the flow of typing. It's a different gesture and takes effort to remember and use.
I need the emoji once a while, but the numeric pad a lot more, so a keypad with a long press to open emoji would be welcome.
I would suggest having the emoji with the return key, and the numeric button could have a long press alternative to the symbols keys.

title: Update localization and remove NO in favor of NB
Refactor keyboard hiding with less flags
Load gesture typing words list from jni
body:
This seems to be working properly in my casual testing. I am open to suggestions if you have a cleaner way of doing this PR, but it should be good to go.

This PR loads words from the built in dictionary. It also adds support for accents to the gesture detector. I have tested it with both english and french (although the size of the french dictionary makes gesturing impractical; even simple words like été have too many similar words close by, making the low accuracy of the gesture detector painfully obvious)

To allow gesturing after switching keyboards, I updated the Rx code to allow it to be cancelled, although I think I am missing something because it is a mess now. One bug that I noticed (both before and after this patch) is that spamming the language button crashes the keyboard. I don't think it is in the scope of this PR to fix, but once this is merged I will see about looking into it.

title: [Feature Request] Support for Chinese (and possibly other languages such as Japanese)
body:
I recently discovered this keyboard alternative and love it because it's libre/open source :)

I was wondering if ASK could be used to input languages like Chinese or Japanese.

For Chinese, there are different ways of entering text. A popular way is to type [Hanyu Pinyin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinyin) (a standardized transliteration system) of the character/words that you want, and the select the words in a list.

For example: I type `wo` and I can select characters such as `我` `沃` `卧` `窩`... (all pronounced "wo").

I had a look at the source code on how to create new language packages, but it looks like it's based on a matches between letters (e.g. if I start typing "fr", I'll have access to words in the dictionary starting with/containing `fr`).

That means for languages such as Chinese, we would need an intermediate state in the dictionary or somewhere else to make the connection between:

1. what the user types (e.g. `fagu`),
2. what pinyin it can match, (e.g. `faguo`)
3. and therefore what Chinese character(s) it could match (e.g. "法國", "faguo").

There are a lot of other subtleties (see below), but what I described above is the core of the issue.

Could a language pack be created for this kind of language? Would it require changes in ASK itself?

Cheers and thanks again!

# Other subtleties to take into account

## Written and spoken Chinese

(I will simplify for the sake of brevity, if you are a Chinese speaker, please bear with me!)

There are two forms of written Chinese:

* Simplified Chinese (used in China); for instance, 法国 is the simplified Chinese for "France"
* Traditional Chinese (used in Taiwan and Hong Kong); 法國 is the Traditional Chinese for "France"

That should not be a problem if ASK can have two different dictionaries.

On top of that, there are two main spoken Chinese variants:

* Mandarin (used in China and Taiwan) 
* Cantonese (used in Hong Kong and Macau)

## Romanization and other transliteration methods

In order to simplify the learning process, China started using a romanization method called [hanyu pinyin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinyin). Each character can be romanized with a syllable and a tone.

For instance, the word "France" in Mandarin can be romanized `fǎ gúo` (that is: `fa` with 3rd [tone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinyin#Tones) and `guo` with the 2nd tone).

In Taiwan, pinyin was never a thing, and instead children are learning Chinese using the [bopomofo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bopomofo) method, which uses a system of syllables. Using this system, "France" in Mandarin can be written `ㄈㄚˇ ㄍㄨㄛˊ`.

The good news is that there are automated methods to turn a hanyu pinyin romanization into a bopomofo set of syllable and vice-versa.

I am not sure how Cantonese is romanized.

## Input methods

Typing Chinese on an electronic device has proven complicated for a long time. There are many, [many ways of typing Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_input_methods_for_computers). 

For hanyu pinyin, since the tones like ˇ or ˊ are not readily available on a qwerty keyboard, they are replaced with their associated number. `fǎ gúo` then becomes `fa3guo2`. But because typing the tones all the time can be quite laborious, many input methods accept the form `faguo` and will present you a list of Chinese characters of words containing these syllables (not necessarily with the right tones). It's then up to the user to select the character/word he wants. Some methods are guessing the word based on the context or based on the previous/following character.

The process is very similar in bopomofo.

## Dictionaries

Fortunately for us, there are some very good dictionaries such as [CC-CEDICT](https://cc-cedict.org/wiki/start) which is available under CC BY-SA license and that includes both traditional and simplified Chinese characters as well as the Mandarin pronunciation in hanyu pinyin (see their [syntax wiki page](https://cc-cedict.org/wiki/format:syntax) for more info).

That means we could create a dictionary for our needs, based on this one, that would include everything needed to type a word (using either pinyin or bopomofo method) and get the associated character(s) (either in its simplified or traditional form).

title: Fix spacing delete and shift for various combinations of typing and gesturing
body:
- Fix spacing and delete for various combinations of typing and gesturing
- Fix spacing and delete for input types (ex: chromium url bar) that don't do auto space
- Delete whole word when deleting a gesture
- Fix shift, caps lock and finishing a gesture by pressing shift

I undid your TextState changes. This implementation has the advantage of working correctly for the cases above (especially the chromium url bar), but it is definitely an abuse of the states. I am not sure how else to implement it though, so I am definitely open to ideas. The tests should handle any regressions if you want to play around with it.

Everything related to gesturing should be inside the withGestureTyping class, which should hopefully make it less awful than the last PR. Also, everything has a check, so this should not introduce any regressions if the feature flag is disabled.

Thanks for getting the mocks set up! They were so helpful. Let me know if you want this PR broken up.

title: Replace duplicates - and ' on FR Azery by left / right navigation keys
body:
Hi, first congratulations and thanks for your hard work on Anysoft Keyboard !

I use the FR-Azerty with dark theme and big keys.

On the penultimate line, right to letters WXCVBN there are - and ' keys.

There are (and some of the long press selection associated) duplicates with the . and ' keys just below on the bottom line.

Would it be possible to replace - and ' after the wxcvbn by the left and right navigation arrows ?

I often need them (mainly these ones, not the up and down) because with my fingers I often miss the exact place to correct a word. I know we can put the navigation on the top line, but here I prefer to have the numbers directly available...

Thanks in advance !

title: Long press selection on FR-Azerty keyboard for U and .
body:
Hi,

There is a small bug on FR-Azerty keyboard : all letters of the first line (AZERTYUIOP), when you long press them, automatically select and write the number (1 2 3 4 5...), except for the U : instead of the "7", it writes the ü.

Also a small suggestion : for the . key on the bottom line, would it be please possible to moove the "..." at the right and make it default long press selection  (currently it is ; ) or at least put it near the ":" ?

Thanks :)

title: [Feature Request] Transparent overlay for current word
body:
Could you write blindly? I cannot write blindly, so I'm looking at the keys I tap/press. So when I write it can happen that I only notice very late that I wrote something wrong, which is very frustrating because I already wrote something after the false letters. I can only prevent this, when I'm often getting feedback of what I wrote by moving my eye focus to the textbox (which can be on top of the screen) or to the proposals what isn't really good either (and permanent motion there shifting alignment).

So what would be for me the best solution to this common problem? : Using a transparent overlay for the keyboard. To visualize what I mean in principle:
![Image](https://i.imgur.com/bcVcKJI.gif)

This is an example for the principle. The color and transparency isn't perfect and maybe a brighter theme for this might be better, but you know what I mean. In function the overlay is ignored, clicking on it just clicks the keys behind the overlay (which we can see).

title: BUG - double clicking a word sometimes deletes it in Gmail + Flickering problem + more
body:
The method `AnysoftKeyboard::performRestartWordSuggestion` is "patchy" because it does the following:
```
ic.deleteSurroundingText(toLeft.length(), toRight.length());
ic.setComposingText(word, 1);
```
The input connection doesn't have to delete text and re paste it, just for the suggestions to work. Please consider using `setComposingRegion` or something else.

This current mechanism causes several problems: flickering upon moving the cursor, problems with styled text (for example in facebook), and the following problem:

### Steps to reproduce
0. Enable "_suggestions restart_" in the keyboard settings.
1. Compose a new message in **Gmail**
2. Write some words (with spaces between them)
3. double click some words several times until the bug happens.

### Expected behaviour
Double clicking a word should select it.

### Actual behaviour
Sometimes the word is **deleted** from the input.

**Android OS version:**
7.1.1

**Device manufacturer and model:**
Samsung Note 8

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
defaults

body:
Hey folks. Thanks for your work on AnySoftKeyboard! 😃

I'm using v1.8.1333 from F-Droid, and have noticed that since quite a while, ASK has had an emoji key which, on short-press, inserts '😃', and on long-press shows the emoji selection menu. I find this an odd choice, as I'm invariably reaching for the menu far, far more often than using that one particular emoji.

I'd like to suggest the following possible behaviours -

title: Fixing issue when pop-up keyboard does not have shifted-codes
[feature request] Switch capitalisation of highlighted word by pressing shift button
body:
I recently switched from WindowsPhone to Android and this is one very useful feature of WPs keyboard that I haven't found on any Android keyboards.

If you highlight, say, an all-lowercase word and then press the shift button on your keyboard, the word gets its first letter capitalised, if you then press shift again, it becomes all-caps, and if you then press it again, it becomes all-lowercase again. After this, the cycle repeats.

Obviously the cycle starts at different points depending on whether the highlighted word is all-lowercaps, capitalised or all-caps.

I would _love_ to see this feature coming to AnySoftKeyboard! Thanks to everybody working on this project :)

body:
It would be nice to have multilingual completion based on the languages currently selected [assuming the user has more than 1 language selected] at least as an option so we can avoid switching locales for typing just one word. Gboard does this currently and I think this would be a nice addition to ASK

title: [Feature Request] Treat ’ like ' in suggestions
body:
Could the curly apostrophe (’) be treated like a regular apostrophe (') in suggestions?

For example, I like to type using the curly apostrophe, which I access by long-pressing on the regular apostrophe key and sliding across to it. However, on some words (e.g. haven’t), the suggestion with the regular apostrophe is automatically accepted when I enter the curly apostrophe (e.g. resulting in haven't’), and then I have to undo this manually.

A basic improvement would be for the curly apostrophe not to trigger suggestions. The ideal would allow me to enable an option to make all suggestions use curly apostrophes instead of regular apostrophes.

title: Android Oreo ROM integration
body:
Hello,

I'm trying to make an usable opensource Android ROM, which would integrate AnySoftKeyboard as primary IME.
Currently this doesn't work, even if AnySoftKeyboard is the only IME, it won't be enabled by default.

As far as I can tell, you'd need to add many subtypes as LatinIME does:
https://android.googlesource.com/platform/packages/inputmethods/LatinIME/+/master/java/res/xml/method.xml

AOSP's framework's selection is done here:
https://android.googlesource.com/platform/frameworks/base.git/+/master/core/java/com/android/internal/inputmethod/InputMethodUtils.java#360

What's your recommendation there?
Thanks

title: Intent protocole to delegate input to third-party apps
body:
### Intent protocole to delegate input to third-party apps

The goal of the intent protocole is to provide an api for integrating third-party apps IME in ASK.

This protocole will allow the community to create applications with some special IME reading capabilities (e.g. barcode scanning, NFC reader, GIF,  image input ...Etc) and return the data to ASK to set the input.

title: Support compose key sequences
body: Support for (at least external keyboard) compose key sequiences. See only lines with `<Multi_key>` in https://cgit.freedesktop.org/xorg/lib/libX11/tree/nls/en_US.UTF-8/Compose.pre and https://www.createspace.com/3758226 I have a Python script that parses the Compose.pre file. I can extend it to output a file suited for ASK. Dead keys are out of scope for me here. Optionally, a compose key could be added to some virtual keyboards. See also https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compose_key and the character on the compose keys should be U+2384 ⎄.

title: 4 characters deleted after a smiley inserted & backspace pressed
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. I insert a smiley by pressing the SMILEY button (smiley is 4 characters long)
2. I go back in the sentence and try to delete one character
3. 4 characters are deleted instead of one

### Expected behaviour
Only 1 character should be deleted when I press the backspace button!

### Actual behaviour
4 characters are deleted instead of one...

**Android OS version:**
7.0

**Device manufacturer and model:**
Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
Hungarian add-on

So in detail:
I have set the smiley button to display a ":-) " smiley with one space at the end (4 characters total).
When I press the backspace button, the app tries to be too smart.... it remembers that I inserted a smiley (4 characters long), so it deletes 4 characters. This is no problem if I try to delete the smiley... But is's a problem when I go back in the sentence to correct a word, and 4 characters will be deleted instead of one!!! I hope you understand the problem... The backspace button should delete only 1 characters, always... If I want to delete the smiley, I will press it 4 times, no problem. :-)

title: Caps Lock Non-functional When Already Capitalized
body:
Reopening https://github.com/AnySoftKeyboard/AnySoftKeyboard/issues/1037 as it is still an issue after the update, and affects the new 'long-press' method as well.

### Steps to reproduce
1.  Make sure capitalization is turned on for the next letter (as it often is at the start of a sentence, start of a text field, or when you hit the shift key once).
2.  Either double-tap _or long-press_ the shift key.

### Expected behaviour
The keyboard should enter caps-lock (all letters will be capitalized until you hit the capitalization/shift key again).

### Actual behaviour
The gesture is ignored; nothing happens. If you long press, the app registers it as a short press. If you double-tapped, the app registers it as two slow single taps (turns to lower case, then turns back to capital letter mode.

**Android OS version:**
5.1

**Device manufacturer and model:**
Moto X 2nd gen

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
Nothing but the defaults for US English.

title: Support autotext for multiple previous words
body:
Please, support autotext for multiple previous words. Note that this is not trivial and should be limited in order to prevent recursion.

Example for Dutch: "trein wagon" → "treinwagon" and  "goederen trein wagon" → "goederentreinwagon" and not "goederen trein wagon" → "goederen treinwagon". This has impact on the order or rules and the word preceding the word group about to get autocorrected should always be checked too to see if no other rules apply.

In short, this is far from trivial and possibly dangerous when configured or implemented incorrectly.

title: Add a few additional short smileys
body:
This PR adds support for `:D` `B)` and `:O`, which are fairly common smileys (to me, at least) but missing form the stock text smileys. 

I also had to make a small change to get this to compile at all, let me know if that shouldn't be added and I'll trash that commit.

One more point, shouldn't the 'long form' of smileys print out long smileys? Pressing on `:-)` prints out `:)` on the debug build (and that makes sense, since that's how it's listed out in the field), but I have a phone with the stable release that /sometimes/ works? I'm not really sure what's going on there. It doesn't matter too much to me, because shorter smileys rule `:)`

Let me know if anything should be changed, or if you spot anything amiss.

title: Complete support quotation marks
body:
Please, complete support quotation marks in bottom row. Currently single quote ' double quote " and u201d ” and u201e „ are supported, see:

    $ cd app/src/main/res
    $ grep -riI 201d *
    ...
    xml/ext_kbd_bottom_row_regular_with_voice.xml
    xml/symbols.xml
    xml/ext_kbd_bottom_row_ng.xml
    xml/ext_kbd_bottom_row_regular.xml
    xml-ar/ext_kbd_bottom_row_regular.xml
    xml-land/ext_kbd_bottom_row_regular.xml

What needs to be added are u201c “ and u2018 ‘ and u2019 ’

When adding these, the total number of extra characters on the key for single quote ' will be six, meaning that the extra characters will still be shown in one row.

The change would be from

    android:popupCharacters=""\u201e\u201d"/>

to

    android:popupCharacters=""\u201c\u201e\u201d\u2018\u2019"/>

in order to keep the order relevant to the general usage.

title: Add the approximate / "almost equal" sign to the (English) keyboards
body:
## the problem

I'd like to use the approximately equal sign (`≈` — "Almost Equal To", U+2248) more often. On desktop I can use the Compose Key configuration, but it's not available in AnySoftKeyboard.


## possible solution

I think it would make sense to add it to the long-press on the equals sign, since it's semantically related, or to the tilde, since it's visually similar.


## my device and software

**Android OS version:** 5.0.1 (unmodified manufacturer's ROM)

**Device manufacturer and model:** Samsung Galaxy S4

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**

* AnySoftKeyboard 1.8.844

title: Add standard double and single curly quotes to the English keyboards
body:
## the problem

It seems funny to me that, if you're willing to dig for it, you can use the French angle quotation marks (`«` and `»`) but not the standard double and single curly quotation marks used in English:

* `“` — Left Double Quotation Mark, U+201C
* `”` — Right Double Quotation Mark, U+201D
* `‘` — Left Single Quotation Mark, U+2018
* `’` — Right Single Quotation Mark,  U+2019


## possible solution

I think it would make sense to add these to the long-press on the straight apostrophe and/or straight double quotes.


## my device and software

**Android OS version:** 5.0.1 (unmodified ROM)

**Device manufacturer and model:** Samsung Galaxy S4

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**

* AnySoftKeyboard 1.8.844

* Esperanto Language Pack (by Menny Even Danan) 20100613

The space bar is drastically reduced in size.

title: Add reversed question mark a.k.a. rhetorical question mark
[Feature Request] Button to launch ZXing's Barcode Scanner as an alt input.
body:
## If barcode scanning is a public good, then barcode input should be just as liberated.


I don't just think of AnySoftKeyboard as a keyboard, it's an input solution. And if the microphone is one such source, then a camera should be equally as available. I'm using the F-Droid version of AnySoftKeyboard.

Replace the microphone button with a "Scan button" that launches the ZXing Barcode Scanner.
Upon scan, have data returned/"pasted"(because the Barcode Scanner copies to clipboard) to the original field AnySoftKeyboard had focus.

Feature accessed: Could be by default, or from "Common Bottom Row" choice, or from long-pressing the microphone(or vice versa).

**Precondition**: User is using a mobile browser of any type, about to focus on a text field.

1. User focuses on a text field.
2. AnySoftKeyboard pops up.
2. User presses Scan button.
3. User is taken to Barcode Scanner.
4. User scans a barcode.
5. Successful scan returns user to their previous application, pasting the copied data.

**Postcondition**: User just scanned a barcode into the app of their choice, from an open source keyboard, using an open source barcode scanner, _practically seamlessly._

Live Example: Firefox https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/scan-qr-codes-firefox-android

---- 

Fork for embedding (featuring portrait scanning): https://github.com/journeyapps/zxing-android-embedded/
Research:
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/29159104/how-to-integrate-zxing-barcode-scanner-without-installing-the-actual-zxing-app/38423626#38423626 ( post 38423626 )
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27851512/how-to-integrate-zxing-library-to-android-studio-for-barcode-scanning/31760440#31760440 ( post 31760440 )


Awesome bonus points if we can adjust post-input keystrokes, like **<nothing>** vs **TAB** vs **ENTER**.

In SMS My Phone send SMS if I press Enter instead do a new line. I'm also not able to change this behavior in settings. Also Shift-Enter do not change it.

title: [Feature Request] Allow changing top and botom icon by drag and drop
body:
There are many type of botom and Top-line themes but neither contain the set of Icons I wish.

Please allow to change the top and bottom keyboard keys with drag and drop from a list.

title: Return Key is Drawn off the Screen
body:
The green return key is drawn on my screen with a right margin too far to the right, a little off the screen. It doesn't line up with the keys above it.

I have a Nexus 5X with Android 6.0.1 and I am using "English QWERTY Latin keyboard with symbols (on long press)" and the "New Generation - Testing" layout.

Does anyone else see this?

title: create keyboard with a Context matching the keyboard's locale
Importing AlternativeEnglishLayouts (Colemak, Dvorak, compact) and SSH/Terminal
Dvorak and Colemak variants
body: Can you add those?

title: Few Suggestions
body:
thank you for your hard work, really appreciate it. a few suggestions for future update.

1. delete word gesture doesn't delete words with space, it clears a word first and then on next gesture it clears the space and then the word again.

2.there should be an option like "Always show suggestions". in some input field, suggestions don't appear. for example search input field in browser or address bar.

3. a keyboard layout, that acts and appears exactly as "smart keyboard pro" should be implemented. trust me this implementation will be welcomed by most users.

4.there should be an option like "no popup on key press".

5.if possible, please implement support for third party keyboard skins.

title: Removing old Drag implementation
body: Using Support-Library's ItemTouchHelper

title: typo in changelog, and adding INTERNET note only in Canary builds
Disable autocomplete drop-down menu?
body:
Is there a way to disable the autocomplete drop-down menu completely? 
How hard would it be introducing a checkbox in the options? 

The drop-down menu always overlaps my arrow keys. I would rather not use it. 

I'm using v1.8-r7.1.

title: Keyboard stay on screen when returning Home (instead of back)
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Write some text (anywhere)
2. Hit the Android "Home Button"

### Expected behaviour
The app and the keyboard are minimized

### Actual behaviour
Only the app is minimized.
The keyboard stay open in over the home screen. I have to hit the back button to close it.

**Android OS version:**
7.0 (OxygenOS 4.0.3)

**Device manufacturer and model:**
OnePlus 3

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
French (AZERTY/bépo)

title: Deploy on every merge to master. #943
Release policy
body: Any commit to master should be published to Alpha channel on Play-Store, with the `canary` variant.

title: using lower-base-char rather than just lower-char. Issue #921
Words with tildes are not suggested when the word is completely written
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Write some word in Spanish with tilde (eg: que/qué, tenia/tenía, podre (there's actually no "podre", just "podré"))
2. See that there's no "qué" suggested when you complete writing "que"
3. delete the last e and put "é" if you want "qué" (which is kind of annoying)

ASF 1.8.585 (F-droid)

### Expected behaviour
words with tildes being shown when you completely write the word

### Actual behaviour
they're not shown

**Android OS version:** 6.0.1

**Device manufacturer and model:** BQ Aquaris M5

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):** Spanish (20110717)

title: French word suggestions do not work with words containing accents
body:
Hello,

Since my latest update (1.8.585), I have found a regression with suggestions.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable suggestions.
1. Switch to French (azerty) keyboard.
2. Type `pates`.

### Expected behaviour
It should suggest `pâtes`.

### Actual behaviour
It only suggests words without accents (pares, payes, etc.).

(But if I type `pâte`, it correctly suggests  `pâtes`.)

**Android OS version:** 5.1

**Device manufacturer and model:** Fairphone 2

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):*** 
* French language pack (20111029)
* SSH language pack (0.4.2012611-beta)

title: Add a button (with e.g. a globe or keyboard icon) for single-tap switching to the "next" IME
body:
Allow the user to switch to the next IME (in a sequence of two or more IMEs) by just tapping once.

It is unlikely that a single IME excels at all aspects of (multilingual) text entry, e.g. it might be great for swiping Livonian, but suck at voice typing Võro. Thus an IME should allow the (multilingual) user to quickly switch to another IME (and the other IME should similarly allow the user to switch back to the initial IME).

Newer versions of Android (v5+) make IME switching simpler than before. One needs to tap the (IME-independent) keyboard icon in the lower (or upper, in case of landscape) right corner and then tap a radio button in the "Change keyboard" dialog that pops up. Even quicker (and with much less cognitive load) is to tap a globe/keyboard button integrated into the active IME. This button should call switchToNextInputMethod with "false" on the 2nd argument.

See also: https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/text/creating-input-method.html#Switching

title: Voice typing is only available via Google Voice Typing
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Click on the mic button
2. Google Voice Typing pops up

### Expected behaviour
The user should be asked (in the settings or upon pressing the mic button) which form of voice typing they want to use. In general, there are 3 different possible forms: SpeechRecognizer service, RecognizerIntent activity, IME (with voice subtype). Each of these can have multiple installed implementations on Android. The user should be given a choice.

### Actual behaviour
If Google's infrastructure is not installed on the device (e.g. CyanogenMod without Google Play services) then RecognizerIntent pops up. (That's a sensible behavior, although a SpeechRecognizer service based solution would be nicer, like done in SlideIT keyboard.) However, if Google's infrastructure is on the device (e.g. Nexus 5X) then no choice is given. 

**Android OS version:**
Android 7.1.2

**Device manufacturer and model:**
Nexus 5X

The fix should probably start with generalizing the line:
https://github.com/AnySoftKeyboard/AnySoftKeyboard/blob/master/app/src/main/java/com/google/android/voiceime/ImeTrigger.java#L38

As an alternative service/activity/IME to test against, one could consider https://github.com/Kaljurand/K6nele.

title: French language use A LOT of apostrophe in words which are reconised as mistakes.
body:
Nevermind, I just found one issue closed with apostrophe in french, I'm sorry to have opened one more !


### Steps to reproduce
1. set the language to french
2. write in french
3. any time it use an apostrophe in the word, the word is correcting in another word, but a wrong one.

### Expected behaviour
Tell us what should happen
The apostrophe (or single quotation mark) hasn't to be recognised as a mistake.

### Actual behaviour
Tell us what happens instead
All words with apostrophe are recognised as wrong and are automatically change in other words.
e.g "je n'ai pas d'idée" which means "I have no idea" is corrected to "je n'ai pas sniffée" "I didn't snort" (drugs), and "n'ai" are not corrected because I already "add" it as a new word in the dictionary.
It is really annoying to add all the dictionary 3 times or more. I can't explain, demonstrate how much we use apostrophe in sentences, just for "aimer" (love) with some combination : j'aime l'application, t'aimes l'application, l'application t'aime, ... And for the negative way : je n'aime pas, tu n'aimes pas, ...
(translation : I like the application, you like the application, the application likes you, I don't like, you don't like)
We can make a lot of combination with word and apostrophe, I agree French has an horrible grammar, but I think turning all "apostrophed" words into another word is a serious brake on the distribution of Anysoftkeyboard in the french speaking country.

**Android OS version:**
4.4.2

**Device manufacturer and model:**
htc desire 320

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
french language, german language

best regards,
JB

title: Turkish "ş" is not really  "ş".
body:
Hi

I like this keyboard a lot and I use it with multiple languages. One issue I have with the keyboard is that when I press "s" for extended letters, I can find "ş" in there but no dictionary accepts this as the regular "ş" from their alphabet so I assume there must be something wrong with its code. On the other hand both the Samsung and Hacker keyboards can print the proper "ş", proper meaning that the letter "ş" corresponds to the actual letter code therefor the dictionaries list the right words with this letter. 

Given that we do not have a separate Turkish keyboard and the rest of the turkish letters on the keyboard works, I assume the turkish alphabet is supported by the keyboard.

I am using it on Samsung Note 4 with Lollipop 5.1

thanks

title: Top Row Key Popups on "QWERTY Latin keyboard with symbols (on long press)" Don't Default To Numbers
body:
In "QWERTY Latin keyboard" when you hold on a key on the top row (without a number hint) it pops up and offers one of the digits FIRST then other symbols if you swipe towards them.

In "QWERTY Latin keyboard with symbols (on long press)" when you hold a key on the top row (WITH a number hint) it SOMETIMES defaults to the digits (with 1, 2, 4, 5, 6) but sometimes has other symbols (with 3, 7, 8, 9, 0) as the first options. This prevents a long-press-release from always being a number.

This is funny, especially because the hint IS the number in the "long press" keyboard where it doesn't always give you a number immediately but the hint is just mostly annoying (with w and p) and mostly useless (the symbols "<->") in the "QWERTY Latin keyboard" where is DOES ALWAYS give you the digit even though it is not the hint. Quite strange choices for the layout of hints.

title: DEPLOY-CANARY: Starting to work on r10
[feature request] Automatically detect language
body:
I frequently switch between French and English. Whenever I start typing in a language different from the one currently set, the spellchecker insists on replacing each word I type, until I manually switch to the correct language.

Wouldn't it be possible that the keyboard automatically detect the language change? When I type words that are incorrect in the current language, but correct in another installed dictionary, it would automatically switch to that language...

Currently, this would also change the keyboard layout, which could arguably be disturbing for the user, so it should be possible to disable the language detect feature -- and probably it should not be enabled by default. In the longer term, as I suggested in #908, the language could be decoupled from the layout...

title: [feature request] Decouple language from keyboard layout
body:
I just installed AnySoftKeyboard and like very much. Thank you for a very good alternative to proprietary keyboards :)

I'm a bit confused, though, by the fact that the keyboard layout is coupled with the spellchecker language. I'm used to the french AZERTY keyboard, regardless of the language in which I write (French or English), so I would like to be able to use an English spellchecker with the AZERTY keyboard as well...

I know I could fix this by proposing a new "english keyboard" with an AZERTY layout, but it would seem cleaner to have the keep the two settings independent (even if each layout could have a *default* dictionary associated to it).

title: Back-word deletes automatic spaces from the previous word
body:
Occurs when deleting less than a whole word. On desktop you would expect Ctrl+Backspace to delete all alphanumeric characters left of the cursor until the next character is a space/special character.

It appears that automatically added spaces stop the previous word also being deleted, but the space is deleted.

Also occurs when deleting less than a full sub-word following a hyphen (or other special character). For example, if # is where the cursor is when shift+backspace is used, the following line is the result:

Auto s#pace
Auto#

Hyphen-nate#d
Hyphen#d

Expected behaviour:

Auto s#pace
Auto #pace

Hyphen-nate#d
Hyphen-d


Also when there is a control key, it does not act as a back word with backspace.

title: Add option to customize the order of appearance of the keyboards
Add option to change the language used in the user interface of the app
body:
Some apps (Firefox, Telegram…) give the option to change the language used in the user interface of the app without changing the locale of the device. It would be great if AnySoftKeyboard did the same.

Basque language is an officially supported language in Android but most manufacturers don’t include it in their custom Android builds yet, as a consecuence, many Basque speakers have devices with Spanish/French locales. I think that it’s a common issue with other minoritary languages as well.

In older versions of Android it was easy to change the locale of the device using apps like EveryLocale, but nowadays it’s more difficult. The user must use adb to give permission to EveryLocale to change the locale, that’s too complex for most users.

title: Rename Related Settings to the Top Extension Keyboard

The others settings around it start with the verbs "Show" and "Use" and so you should start this setting with a verb too. It is better form to say in a setting what the action the setting does rather than what the object it manipulates is, in my opinion.

title: hidden fallback theme should be found by id. Issue #835 and #831
Android automatic refactor - Recycle
body:
Hi,

I am developing a tool to automatically refactor Android applications with the goal of improving energy efficiency.
This pull request has the changes generated while applying the rule "Recycle".

Some resources (e.g., ```Cursor``` instances) should be closed when they are no longer necessary. 

I have made a previous validation of the changes and they seem correct.
Please consider them and let me know if you agree with them.

Best,
Luis

title: Wider spacebar to avoid accidental full stop presses
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Try type quickly a sentence with spaces in it, like this one.
2. Notice that the above sentence looks like this: `Try type.quickly a sentence.with spaces.in it, like this one.`
3. Get annoyed

Often I and I'm sure many others hit the `.` full stop character by accident instead of the spacebar. Would be awesome if I could configure the spacebar to be wider and disable other character keys on the bottom row as mentioned in #716

title: custom permissions request for Contacts from notification. Issue #800
Implement experimental gesture typing
body:
Solves issue 264

TODO:
- Undo making some of the members public
- I have no idea how to make the corrections work properly, or how to get the data I need for automatic capitalization and spacing (see AnyKeyboardView onTouch)
- I added a wordlist txt file, because I couldn't figure out how to get a list of words from the native dictionary
- I have no clue how to access the character associated with a key (I was getting weird null errors), so I used label instead. This is obviously a horrible hack
- It currently checks that you started your gesture near a key with a latin a-z or A-Z key to see if gesturing is enabled. Also a massive hack (see GestureTypingDetector isValidStartTouch)
- Enhance gesture detector: My plan was to implement something similar to the linked paper in the issue, but it looks like that will require a linear scan through all of the words in the dictionary. For each word, we can compute a probability that it is the correct word, and then sort the words based on this probability.

title: Work in progress - Implement experimental gesture typing
body:
From issue 264. Currently, this is nowhere close to being ready to merge, but I wanted some feedback. 

All of these points also have associated TODO items in the code.

- There are a number of classes that I've tightly coupled AnyKeyboardView to, and that is a clear sign that something needs to change with the organization of my code. I would love suggestions.
- I have no idea how to make the corrections work properly, or how to get the data I need for automatic capitalization and spacing (see AnyKeyboardView onTouch)
- I added a wordlist txt file, because I couldn't figure out how to get a list of words from the native dictionary
- I have no clue how to access the character associated with a key (I was getting weird null errors), so I used label instead. This is obviously a horrible hack
- It currently checks that you started your gesture near a key with a latin a-z or A-Z key to see if gesturing is enabled. Also a massive hack (see GestureTypingDetector isValidStartTouch)
- The gesture detector currently is very picky, but I want to get the issues above sorted out before tackling that. My plan was to implement something similar to the linked paper in the issue, but it looks like that will require a linear scan through all of the words in the dictionary (see the TODO item). If you can think of a way of optimizing this (perhaps some kind of tree? I'll see if the paper has a suggestion for this), that would be great, but for the first release I think a linear scan should be fine.

I am willing to work through all of these issues, but I think a second set of more experienced eyes would be great. I really appreciate you taking the time to review this!

title: Suggested words/the quality of the suggestions are low
body:
### Expected behaviour
Before I downloaded the last version the suggested words worked excellent, always suggested the most closer words for what I wanted to use, its guesses was highly accurate.

### Actual behaviour
Now as I typing words the quality of the suggestions are low are pretty low. Like I type
**let** for let's, but the suggested words I got: _lethal, lets, letters, lettings,_ let's...
**don** for don't, but the suggested words I got: _Donaldson, Donahue, donors, donkey, donald, donate, done, donations,_ don't... (I don't even have any Donaldson or Donahue in my conctact list)
**beli** for believe, but the suggested words I got: _believable, bell, belies, belief, belitted, believes, believer, believed, believing, beliefs,_ believe...
**typ** for typing, but the suggested words I got: _typhoons, typically, typifies, typical, type, typography, typhoon,_ typing
**tou** for touch, but the suggested words I got: _toughened, touching, tourists, tourist, tourism, tour, touched, touches, though,_ touch... 
**thou** for thought, but the suggested words I got: _thoughtful, thousand, though, thoughts, thoughtfully,_ thought...
**thro** for through, but the suggested words I got: _theo, throwing,_ through

It's just a few from the most used words where I want type something and the suggestion give seriously  different words, and most of time I have to scroll a lof to find a word I would like to use.... I don't want to show myself like somebody who always complain or are lazy, but this worked pretty well before the last update, and now it isn't.

See as I wrote in the examples, like the "don" for don't, that's the worst one, but not the last like that. As english isn't my original language the correct suggestions are pertty important to me, make my typing faster and easier.
Can you correct it and restore it as it was before? Thank you.

I made a video, but I only can share it with youtube:
https://youtu.be/RKz_tHhVnW8

**Android OS version:**
Android 4.4.2

**Device manufacturer and model:**
Vodafone Smart 4.

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
Added hungarian language from playstore

title: Bump relinker to latest version (minor version bump)
"Split/Merge initial state" set to "Start split in landscape" Acts Strange After Many Orientation Changes
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Set Split/Merge Initial State to "Start split in landscape"
2. In portrait mode, tap in a field to open keyboard
3. You see the proper behavior of no split
4. Turn the phone to landscape
5. It is not split. ok, it just says "STARTS split", i understand.
6. Turn it BACK to portrait.
7. It is SPLIT!

The same thing happens starting in the other state. Start in landscape, switch to portrait then back to landscape, it is NOT SPLIT!

I am using Cyanogenmod 13 on a Nexus 5X.

This is just not the intended consequence of the setting. It should stay split in landscape all the time if i start split in landscape.

I suggest you add another option to the setting "Keep split in landscape and regular in portrait". Isn't that what most people would want anyway? I can't imagine wanting LESS room for the keys in portrait anyway... I would make my new option the default.

OR, why not just create two settings, one that sets the starting state in portrait and the other that sets the starting state in landscape? Then keep the current state for each in a flag bit until the next keyboard opens...

OR add another setting "Remember last split/merge state for each orientation"...

Anyway, I think a rehaul of the control over this feature is in order!

I see there is no way to disable the top extension keyboard... I would like to.

I also suggest you conform the way you refer to it. Is it an "extension keyboard" or a "top extension keyboard"? Maybe change "Sticky extension keyboard" to "Make top extension keyboard sticky"... The others settings around it start with verbs "Show" and "Use" and it is also better form to say in a setting what the action is than what the object is, in my opinion.

title: Rename Words "full-screen" to "full-screen editor" and Match Dark/Light in Editor
body:
The use of the words in the settings "Use portrait full-screen" and "Use landscape full-screen" were confusing to me. For a while I thought it was referring to the default length of the keyboard (split or regular) and so I ended up turning on and dealing with the horribly disruptive "full-screen" mode and not understanding why. In some apps it would open a huge ugly white full screen editor, blocking important visibility in the app, and abruptly changing themes on me as I have dark theme on in a lot of apps and the full-screen editor is always white.

The full-screen editor is very bad in messaging apps as you can not read the conversation history while you type. Interestingly, In Signal and Whatsapp the full screen editor works but in Telegram Messenger it does not. These are all open source apps so the code could be examined to see why.

I recommend renaming the setting "full-screen" to "full-screen editor" to make it clearer what is actually full-screen... or maybe there is another way to explain it.

In my programs which have a dark theme, the abrupt change to white is a problem, it is ugly and disruptive. The editor should match with dark or light depending on the app it is opening within, if this is even possible.

title: Suggestions do not reappear after reopening the keyboard
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Type `genetal`. A suggestion of `general` will appear
2. Press the back button
3. Move the cursor to the end of the word. The only suggested word is `genetal` itself. `general` should appear.
4. Press backspace twice. You have `genet`. Words like `genetic` appear. But after typing `al` back again, `general` is not suggested either
5. Press backspace again, so that you have `gene`. Then type `tal`. Now `general` is suggested. 

It seems that the match algorithm assumes the already typed part of the string as 100% correct. Instead, it should provide autocorrect even for the words already there.

**Android OS version:** CM 13.0

**Device manufacturer and model:** OnePlus 3

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):** n/a

title: Optionally hyphen key instead of voice key
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Look at the keyboard
2. Tap on the voice key (microphone)
3. Popup "Voice is Not Installed"

### Expected behaviour
Tell us what should happen

### Actual behaviour
Tell us what happens instead

**Android OS version:**
all

**Device manufacturer and model:**
all

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
none

Some users never ever want to use voice input, for whatever reason. For these users the key with the microphone is taking up space and is not only non-functional, it could be used in a functional way.

I would like to propose that the popup dialog "Voice is Not Installed" offers a third option (a wide button) below the two existing choices called: "Never show voice, show hyphen instead". And the text below: "Showing hyphen key instead of voice key can be undone via AnySoftKeyboards settings."

When the user chooses "Never show voice, show hyphen instead", a key with a hyphen is shown instead of the microphone key. When the user goes into settings menu of anySoftKeyboard, there would be always a boolean setting called  "Never show voice key, show hyphen key instead" which is off/false by default. When the choice discussed above has been chosen, this boolean will be set to on/true. The user can manipulate this setting and the effect can be seen on the keyboard.

Implementing this will improve the speed of using the hyphen, which is very common in certain languages or contexts, especially for users that never ever want to use voice input.

See the attachment for an impression.

![screenshot_20161103-144947](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3276314/19968597/8accc5f6-a1d5-11e6-93e5-ed0947544264.png)

PS   The two sentences shown currently at the top of this dialog should not be on two different lines. So no new line after "... on your device." but directly continue with "That can be ..."

title: Add greek alphabet to english long-press popups
Cannot disable top row numbers in latest update
body:
**EDIT:**
It seems that the issue does not appear in all text fields. The only place I am noticing it currently is in the search field for the KISS launcher.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Installed latest version from F-Droid
2. Navigate to "Even more..." in the User Interface section of the ASK settings app.
3. Set "Common top generic row" to "No top row"

title: [FEATURE REQUEST]When using physical keyboard in combination with the option to hide the virtual keyboard after first input implement option to continue showing suggestions
body:
Hi,

great app which nearly completely weaned me off Hacker's Keyboard after having used it for easily over more than 5 years. ;)

Now as for my feature request as the title already says it would be great to have a way of continuing to display word suggestions and/or corrections when using a physical keyboard combined with the option to hide the virtual keyboard after the first 'physical' input.

As a further enhancement of that it would immensely help productivity when picking/controlling the then so displayed suggestions/corrections could be controlled via keyboard shortcuts as to avoid being forced to touch the screen to say select a specific entry .

Looking forward to hear your opinions on this idea.

Cheers,
R

title: Show numbers top row when in a password field
[REQUEST] HTC_IME-style theme
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Default behavior
### Expected behaviour

Visible, easy-viewable function-key text
### Actual behaviour

Function-key text difficult to read.

**Android OS version:**
Marshmallow

**Device manufacturer and model:**
N5

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
N/A

Would it be possible to add an HTC_IME-style theme to AnySoft Keyboard?

My favorite Android keyboard was the HTC_IME Mod found in these XDA threads:

http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1844512
http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1594642

It was my go-to KB for speed and ease-of-use. The taller keys allowed displaying larger long-press functions. It was much easier to read, even on smaller displays.

The HTC_IME Mod keyboards quit working when I upgraded to my N5 running KitKat. Smart Keyboard is close, and Tswipe is even closer. However, neither is an open source solution.

Your theme "Simple black glow" is very close; to match the HTC_IME concept, the main text letters on the keys would have to be lowered to allow enlarging the function key text above them. The keys could also have their height increased slightly too.

I'm also attaching a screenshot of the HTC KB layout.
![htc_ime](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22090592/19017023/57b1671a-87f1-11e6-9187-2a01bebfcfd2.jpg)

title: [Vietnamese] Support telex typing
body:
Hi all,
At first, this is the vietnamese alphabet: a, ă, â, b, c, d, đ, e, ê, g, h, i, k, l, m, n, o, ô, ơ, p, q, r, s, t, u, ư, v, x, y and 05 accent marks: acute accent("´"), grave"`"), hook(" ̉ "), tilde("~") and dot(".")

And these are some telex typing rules:
aa = â
aw = ă
ew = ê
oo = ô
ow = ơ
dd = đ
uw = ư
Typing 05 diacritics (or accent marks):
-To add acute accent: S, for example: as=á.
-To add grave accent: F, for example: af=à
-To add hook accent: R, for example: ar=ả
-To add tilde accent: X, for example: ax=ã
-To add dot accent: J, for example: aj=ạ.

More example: if we want to write Việt Nam, need to type: Vieetj Nam or Vieejt Nam or Vietej Nam or Vietje Nam.

google keyboard version 5.0.1 (file apk on CHplay ) supported typing but i can't find google keyboard source code version 5.0.1
can you help me?

title: poor prediction / suggested words
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. start typing words
2. get poor predictions
3. (see "Actual behaviour" below
### Expected behaviour

More accurate predictions.

e.g. 
- If you start typing the word, offer up  the singular version first instead of the plural/past/future and having the singular 4 or 5 suggestions down if at all
### Actual behaviour

Predictions for words appears to be quite poor

| Typing | Gives | Expected |
| --- | --- | --- |
| fal | false / falls / falling / fall | Why not suggest _fall_ earlier |
| wal | Wales / Waller / walks / Walter / Waller's / walk | Why not _walk_ earlier, what on earth is _waller_ |
| lov | / log / loved / loves / loving / love | again _love_ seems more logical to suggest earlier |
| th | that/ than / they / them / then / this / though / through / the | _the_ is way down the list, would expect to at least come before though and through |
| wiat | wish/wistfulness/ Wisteria / .... | expected to correct to _wait_ but not suggested |
| milliona | millions / million's / millionairess / millionaire | would expect _millionaire_ first |
| lin | lines / line / link /... | expect _line_ to be first option |
| yo | to / go / your / you / you're | expect you to be an earlier suggestion |

More as I recall them

**Android OS version:**
Android 4.4.4

**Device manufacturer and model:**
Samsung Galaxy S4

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
No add-ons, just AnySoftKeyboard with "English QWERTY keyboard" 

Next words suggestions set to "suggest next words"
Next word aggressiveness set to "Medium"
Quick fixes and abbreviations set to "on"
Learn method set to "after some usage"
contacts dictionary is "off"

title: Build broken after move to app/
body:
We used to build in F-Droid like this:

`gradle makeEnglishDictionary assembleRelease`

Since you moved to `app/`, we're now running it in there. I had to modify the steps to these for it to work, since you didn't move the dictionary task:

`gradle :makeEnglishDictionary assembleRelease`

Which then fails:

```
* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':makeEnglishDictionary'.
> Could not get unknown property 'android' for root project 'com.menny.android.anysoftkeyboard' of type org.gradle.api.Project.
```

If the answer to this is "run it from the root of the repo", then having the app subdir makes no sense at all.

title: Status bar icon should be shown only between onStartInput and onFinishInput
Improve speed when loading dictionary
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hello Menny,

I have found that `AsyncTask.execute` is used to load main dictionary and abbreviation dictionary in `setMainDictionary` in class Suggest. However, this API became slower on devices newer than Honeycomb. Tasks started by this API will be run sequentially in one thread instead of in real multiple threads. (Found in [API guide](http://developer.android.com/intl/zh-cn/reference/android/os/AsyncTask.html#execute%28Params...%29)) So that abbreviation dictionary will be loaded after loading main dictionary finished.

Use executeOnExecutor instead will schedule tasks to real multiple threads and speed up this process.

Thanks.

title: Import words from SwiftKey
body:
Feature request to import words from SwiftKey. This can be run upon installation once or manually whenever the users feels like.

The files from SwiftKey with extentions .lm containing words are binary. The format is hinted by "Dynamic language model created in DynamicTermModel" in the beginning of the file. Files can also have the extension .lm1 .lm2 and .lm3

lm stands for language model and there will probably be an n-gram and/or word frequency list in the files.

title: Package newer AnySoftKeyboard for F-Droid
body:
The last update to AnySoftKeyboard in F-Droid[0] is three years old. It would be wonderful if F-Droid received the same treatment as Google Play. There are a lot of people out there that refuse to use Google Play, and F-Droid is the main package manager used by them.

It looks rather trivial to author F-Droid packages (as an example, here's the AnySoftKeyboard package: [1]), but I don't know a lot about building Java/Android projects myself.

It would also be nice to have more themes and languages available in F-Droid. I feel rather useless without a Dvorak layout!

Thank you for your time and consideration.

[0]  https://f-droid.org/
[1]  https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/blob/master/metadata/com.menny.android.anysoftkeyboard.txt
