title: Please return back ŗ and ō for Latvian layout
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Set up Latvian layout for keyboard
2. Check that no letters with diacritics marks are provided for r and o letters
### Expected behaviour

Letters ŗ and ō were removed from Latvian language during Soviet times.
Even reasoning was that it will make writing simpler, it actually worsened language rules because "simplification" added inconsistencies in many rules:
1. In consonant flexion (e.g. **egLe**, **egĻu**, and also should be: **vaRa**, **vaŖu**, not **vaRa**, **vaRu**),
2. homonyms where they should not be (e.g. **vaRu**, **vaŖu**, **gaRa**, **gaŖa** are different words),
3. no consistency how o is pronunciated (e.g. **koks** can be spelled as "_kuoks_" or "_koks_", **borons** is actually spelled as "_borōns_", etc.)
### Actual behaviour

Keyboard should propose entering diacriticized letters **ŗ** and **ō** for **r *\* and **o** accordingly.

**List of installed add-ons (like languages, or themes):**
Latvian language

title: Show virtual keyboard on physical keyboard not working
body:
Tried out the beta but the option in the settings has no effect.

See bug https://github.com/AnySoftKeyboard/AnySoftKeyboard/issues/225

Affected ROM: MIUI v7 - all 

Not Affected (tested): Stock Android Lollipop - all (AOSP) -
Fix: Possibly try to use another rom, or the stock android rom for your Xiaomi device, if its MIUI based.
Go to Languages and Input > Current keyboard > Turn "[Hardware] Show Input Methods" ON .

Affected AnySoftKey software version : 1.7.50 - all

title: Allow to switch dictionnaries the same way as keyboard layouts
body:
This is a feature request. Right now keyboard layout and dictionaries are considered more or less independent (each layout has a preferred dicitonary, but that's it). However, in some cases it'd be nice to switch to another dictionary the same way as of keyboard layout (eg, left/right swift on the space key).
There are two cases, which I both face:
- Some languages (eg, Dutch) use the US keyboard layout, so they don't have their own layout. Still, it'd be nice to switch between Dutch and English the same way as you switch between German and English.
- Some languages have keyboard layouts so similar but with small differences that it's annoying to have the layout changed just because you're writting in a different language. For instance, I prefer to write French and English with the same (US) keyboard layout, the same way that it works on a physical keyboard.

So it'd be nice to either:
- Be able to switch dictionaries by swift on the space key or via the "world" key
- Be able to "create" new keyboard layouts by selecting a layout and a dictionary.

title: Missing symbols key on bottom bar (Alternate layout)
body:
Hi, there are several bootom bar which we can choose, but most of them have little space bar.
The only one which has a larger space bar... misses symbols key. Indeed on the left side there is a "switch language" key, which is redundant with the space bar behavior to switch between languages. I think we should remove this "switch language" key on the left and replace it by a symbols key.

title: Feature request: Domain key additional choises
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi,

There are many different domains available today: com, net, gov, edu, etc.
I would like to be able to define my multiple domains, e.g. .com, .net, .co.il, .ru.
When there are multiple domains a domain key press would pop up a floating keyboard with my domains and I would be able to choose a domain I need at the moment.

Thanks

title: Feature Request: "Numers extension keybord" symblols on long press
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi,

I use a "numbers extension keyboard" only for its symbols, and number top row for numbers.
It would be nice to have the same symbols on each top row number long press: e.g. log press on "0" would give me "?", long press on "7" would insert ":".

Thanks in advance

title: Detect text smileys an undo the punctuation swap
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: I'm quite used to typing simple text smileys manually, but ASK swaps the preceding space and the colon, turning `:)` into `: )`. I think it should be possible to detect this and similar patterns and undo the swap when such situation occurs.

title: Better handle of suggestions
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi, thanks for this awesome keybooard.
However, I think that suggestions could be handled in a different way, kinda like AOSP keyboard does.

Accented characters should be handled like standard letters. Let me give you an exemple : 
If I tap "ca", then suggestions should show me "ça" in first entry because "ca" does not exist in French, and then the first thing suggestions should tell me is "ça" which is a common word in French.

Suggestions should also handle better character apostrophe. When I tap "cest", suggestions should show me "c'est" in first choice (or even in second or third), but at the moment "c'est" is not even shown. I have t manually tap the apostrophe character.

Well just a piece of feedback

title: Gesture "Swipe up" works incorrect for "Toggle uppercase"
body:
Just tried AnySoftKeyboard-release-1.6.97-all.apk.

The gesture works OK for uppercase toggle, but does not work for lowercase toggle.

How to reproduce the bug.

The keyboard is now in lowercase state. I swipe up. Now I'm in UPPERCASE state. That's ok.
 But now I swipe up to shift back to lowercase state. But I still see UPPERCASE letters.

After some testing I found that when I start to swipe up the keyboard really toggles back to lowercase, but when I continue swiping in shifts to UPPERCASE again.

title: Too quick taps cause wrong characters
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
In Hungarian language you have to press certain keys twice to get an accented character. Like hitting 'a' twice gets you an 'á'. However, many times, hitting 'a' + other key + 'a' again gets you 'aá', regardless of the second character.

This way if you type 'mama' fast, you will get 'maá'.

What presumably happens is that when you hit the second 'a' the app senses that not long ago you had hit another 'a', so now it must delete one character and replace it with an 'á'. It doesn't take into account that another key was hit between the two 'a' keys.

This bug has been around for a few years now, and I hate to see that such a nice app cannot be used reliably.

I believe the bug is in the main app, and not in the hungarian addon, however, I report this to both contacts.

- [ ] Keep next-suggestions while user type, and give those suggestions high priority
- [ ] Should be case insensitive
- [ ] Should have a simple clear next-word data button in settings
- [ ] Should show very basic statistics about next-word storage

title: Auto-picked suggestion aggressiveness
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Auto-pick suggestion should be based on word distance.
Levels of aggressiveness:
 1) Do not auto-select
 2) Minimal aggressiveness (distance <= 1 AND length diff <= 1)
 3) Medium aggressiveness (distance <= 3 AND length diff <= 2)
 4) High aggressiveness (distance <= 4 AND length diff <= 3)
 5) Extreme aggressiveness (distance <= 5)

default is Medium aggressiveness

1. The keyboard has several dark but just one light theme. Probably it will be a good idea to inverse each dark theme and add it as new light theme?
2. Maybe make "Lean Dark - Option 2" theme (and its future light version) even more minimalistic? I mean, just black and white, no more colors (or, if really needed, a bit of gray). As of now, this theme uses violet color as a background in letter suggestion.

When creating a new layout it is possible to define what happens when shift is on and locked trough the ask:shiftedCodes= and  ask:shiftedKeyLabel strings.

The same should be possible for the alt end sym meta keys a strings like ask:altedCodes= symedCodes= altshiftedCodes= symshiftedCodes= should exist. 

Would it be possible to implement these into AnySoftKeyboard?

Thank You

K.

title: incorrect/confusing labeling on language switch button
body:
Reproduction scenario:
1. Install more than one language. Let say English is the first one an, say, Russian the second.
2. select English using upper right button
3. Switch to "Numbers" mode using upper left button.
4. The upper right button is now labeled "Russian" but pressing switched to English layout

Expected behavior: when switching to numbers layout, the upper right button will be labeled with currently selected language (because pressing it always returns to current language)

title: Newbie here. How to add a new language?
body:
Sorry, I couldn't find any instructions on how to add new languages and browsing the code is ... kinda time-consuming you know :)
So what are the requirements for a new language to be added?
A frequency dictionary? In what format?
How do I specify turning off/on capitalization of first letters of sentences?

Finally are there any guidelines which files constitute localization so that I know where should I push?

title: The DV layout reorders what i type limiting maximum speed
body:
Hey.  I love this product and have donated.  I wonder if you could check into this issue i've been having on Dvorak; i can only type so quickly or else the letters will appear (in correct order) and then rearrange to a different (read: wrong) order.  It seems to happen in portrait mode espeically, where keys on the left side, even if tapped later, may be rendered BEFORE keys on the right side.

So i type words like 'captain' and for a brief moment 'captain' is rendered but it changes to 'captnai' or similar.  Its threshold is too low when lots of memory or cycles are being eaten by processes.

title: Min SDK
body:
Hi,

If i change the minimum sdk of the project to 3.0 from 2.1 the application is not working. The issue is that i can run the application but the keyboard is not opened. Also there is no crash.

Here is the stack track:

 E/Trace﹕ error opening trace file: No such file or directory (2)
A/libc﹕ Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) at 0xdeadd00d (code=1), thread 7053 (ojikeyboardplus)
E/Trace﹕ error opening trace file: No such file or directory (2)
com.emojikeyboardplus A/libc﹕ Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) at 0xdeadd00d (code=1), thread 7076 (ojikeyboardplus)

Can you please help me in this regards?

title: Handle Android 6.0 permissions model
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: With Android M, users have the ability to disable permissions after install.

title: Word triggered icon suggestion
body: It would be nice to have a word triggered icon suggestion. If the user types the word "baby" (in their own language), the suggestion window should show the baby unicode icon: 🚼

title: Add Snackbar to show 'Added','Deleted' action results
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Using Design Support library

title: Migrate User Dictionary Editor to use RecyclerView
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]

title: Associate Last used layout per App package
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Should not be persistent between ASK shutdowns.
Should have an AskPrefs settings.
This is enabled by default.

title: Remember last used language, even if ASK is shutdown
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Keep last used keyboard layout in prefs.
Should have a AskPrefs settings

title: Power Saving Mode
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: In a _Power Saving Mode_ AnySoftKeyboard will not perform dictionary lookups, will not perform any animation, and will not show popups.

title: Korean language
body: Is there a korean keyboard done ? Or the question is does AnySoftKeyboard has the korean language formula implemented ?

title: Allow overriding main keyboard paddings
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Specific values for left, right and bottom.

This setting should be in the Theme Tweaks section.

In a future release, we'd like to have a wizard that helps you determine the values for those padding.

title: ASK issue error message device not supported
body:
Hello

I tried several times to install ASK on the an Android based box from this family
www.solid-run.com

Got error message that the ASK version is not suitable for this device, which is very strange.

Thanks for the great work
  Orma

title: Support for Bigram dictionaries
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
- [x] Initial feature should be _learned_ dictionaries.
- [x] Should also have an option to enable/disable ngram
- [x] Default value: TRUE for API level >= JELLY_BEAN (16).
- [x] Should not allow more that 900 words in the next-words-dictionary
- [x] Allow aggressiveness setting
- [x] Keep next-suggestions while user type, and give those suggestions high priority
- [x] Should be case insensitive
- [x] Should have a simple clear next-word data button in settings
- [x] Should show very basic statistics about next-word storage

*\* "Previous words" memory should be cleaned in these cases: **
- [x] Language change
- [x] New input-connection
- [x] User types punctuation or New-Line

title: Cannot turn on Caps Lock
body: Caps Lock is said to be working by pressing Shift twice, but it doesn't work on any of my devices (HTC One M7 and a Wayteq tablet with ICS)

title: Caps lock issue with JuiceSSH
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: I'm using JuiceSSH, and when I'm in the terminal, press Shift then a letter, Shift remains active. To turn off Caps Lock(?) I have to press Shift twice (time between presses doesn't count)

title: program will crash if the minSdkVersion changed
body:
I upgrade the minSdkVersion in build.gradle from 7 to 10, the program will crash. (the emoji utf-8 code can't be recognized as a utf-8 string ). Is there any solutions to use higher sdk?

title: Enhancement request: Long press on space bar to select among input methods (e.g. Handwriting)
body:
I just installed the new [Google Handwriting Input application.](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.apps.handwriting.ime)

It seems to me that:

If the Anysoft keyboard is the active input method that there is no way to get to {switch to the Handwriting input method}.

If Handwriting is the active input method, then a long press on the {space bar} lets me switch to Anysoft.

According to the [Handwriting Input FAQ](https://support.google.com/faqs/faq/6188721?hl=en)

"How can I switch back to handwriting from another input method?
"That may depend on the other input method. Often this behavior is triggered by a globe button or a long-press on e.g. the space bar."

Will you be updating Anysoft to be able to switch to another input method?

title: Shifted characters not working in Thai
body:
I'm trying to develop a Thai keyboard extension for AnySoftKeyboard. There is one floating around on the web, but it does not work well.

Here's my problem: the "h" key (for example) should produce the letter "mai tho" when unshifted, and "mai taikhu" when shifted. So I put this in the xml configuration:

<Key android:codes="0xe49" android:keyLabel="\u0e49"
ask:shiftedCodes="0xe47" ask:shiftedKeyLabel="\u0e47"/>

But: Unicode thinks "mai tho" is a "non-spacing mark", not a letter, so in AnySoftKeyboard.java, calling isWordSeparator() for this character returns true. This causes onKey() to call handleSeparator() instead of handleCharacter(), and handleSeparator() does not process the the shiftCodes array. The effect is that pressing "mai taikhu" in shifted
mode prints "mai tho" instead.

Note that Thai does not, in fact, have any word separators: all the words are run together with no spaces.

A partial workaround is to add "mai tho" (and a lot of other characters) to additionalIsLetterExceptions. But: these exceptions are only consulted by isWordSeparator() when mPredicting is true. So this workaround works when typing in some places, but not in others.

title: Auto-capitalization bug in 16key layout
body:
For a few weeks ago I see some bug when using 16 key layout. When I'm writing a new sentence, it automatically "shifts" first letter to be a capital. It is ok. But if I write some letter which is not at a first position at desired key, it stays in capitals until I write some letter which is at first position or if i press spacebar.

For example:
I want to Write: "Hello, my name is Tomas Hrochmut."
On display is: "HELLO, my name is Tomas HROCHMut."

So, if i start sentence or name with capital letter and I do not write one of these letters (A, D, G, J, M, P, T, W, dot, spacebar), it does not switch automatically back to small letters.
It does not matter if I write quickly or slowly. Installed on Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini (GT-I8190N).

![screenshot_2015-04-10-11-02-31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11884418/7085411/c9de5ff2-df76-11e4-93b4-6023c966d5f3.png)

Here's the manifest I'm using - I've trimmed it down to just the bottom row - still crashes but works.

``` xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
      package="com.anysoftkeyboard.languagepack.tlhIngan"
      android:versionCode="8"
      android:versionName="Hamlet 2.1 - Bean">      
    <uses-sdk android:minSdkVersion="3" android:targetSdkVersion="15"></uses-sdk>
    <supports-screens
        android:xlargeScreens="true" 
        android:largeScreens="true" 
        android:normalScreens="true"
        android:smallScreens="true"
        android:anyDensity="true" />
          <!-- http://d.android.com/guide/practices/screens_support.html read about legacy. -->

    <application android:icon="@drawable/app_icon" android:label="@string/app_name" android:description="@string/app_desc" >
        <receiver android:exported="true" android:name="com.anysoftkeyboard.languagepack.tlhIngan.PackBroadcastReceiver">
            <intent-filter>
                <action android:name="com.anysoftkeyboard.plugin.EXTENSION_KEYBOARD"/>
                <category android:name="android.intent.category.DEFAULT"/>

            <meta-data android:name="com.anysoftkeyboard.plugindata.extensionkeyboard" android:resource="@xml/extension_keyboards"/>
        </receiver> 
    </application>
</manifest> 
```

Could it be the problem is the PackBroadCastReceiver.java ?
It's just this:

``` java
package com.anysoftkeyboard.languagepack.tlhIngan;

}
```

title: Use multiple Popup windows for showing previews
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Use a FIFO queue to retrieve preview window for the key.
Devices running:
- API 10 or earlier should have 2 item in the queue.
- API [11-13] should have 3 items
- API >= 14 should have 5 items

title: Refactor change-log mechanism
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Should not use implicit changelog layout files.
Instead, use code to define change-log entries.

title: Auto-capitalization capitalizes two letters instead of one.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
There is a recurring issue of auto-capitalization consistently rendering the first TWO letters as capitals when text is input quickly into any text field: word processors, messaging apps, and the Firefox browser. This problem presents any time that auto-capitalization would be incurred: new sentences, after returns, or upon the first words in a text field. I am running version 136 1.3.20150322 of A.S.K. on a Samsung Galaxy Tab2 10.1 with the default OS. An image of this issue is attached. 
![screenshot_2015-04-04-15-31-48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11801335/6995059/ce6bbbf0-dae4-11e4-9f6d-f113af66dd10.png)

Separately, it would be really great if the vertical height of the "suggested text bar" at the top of the keyboard were configurable; I often mistakenly minimize the keyboard when attempting to select a word from this list.

title: Suggestions row "pushes" up page of current app which causes app's page to be hidden
body:
Reproducing:
1. Have "Show suggestions" turned on in "Special dictionaries" setting
2. Open Whatsapp, for example but happens in other apps
3. In one of the chats, touch the message box to start typing
4. Start typing and continue typing until "Suggestions" row appears (by default should appear after two characters)

Actual:
App's page is pushed up by the "Suggestions" row so its top part is hidden a little

Expected:
App's page shouldn't be pushed up but rather its height should be reduced from the bottom.

Reproduced on:
Nexus 5, Lollipop 5.1

title: feature request: Add option to disable tiling
body:
I am using ASK on a htc vision with CM7 and sometimes ASK tiles the keyboard. From my perspective I see no reason why ASK is tiling the keyboard and I do not like it. I want to have the keys always at the same place. In the settings I found only an option on how to start the keyboard.

So please add an option to disable the keyboard tiling.

title: Add space to numbers keypad
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi,

Thanks for adding dot to the numbers keypad (very usefull to input IP addresses !), but it'd be even better to be able to input space as well, wich comes in very handy when inputting phone numbers, for instance (e.g. +33 1 23 45 67 89)

Maybe as a pop-up on the dot key ?

That space should however ignore the "space gets back to the letters keyboard" option though. Otherwise, it'd be of little value.

title: When entering a new text-edit, and the shift is turned auto-on, holding it (to keep the text uppercased) will move the shift state to un-shifted
label: [Label(name="bug")]

title: Caps lock by long-press on the shift key
body:
Hi,

Unless I'm mistaken, the way to enable caps lock is to double-tap on the shift key, right (I'm using the french bépo layout) ?

Would it be possible to enable caps lock by long-pressing shift instead (or in addition) ?

What's more, the shift key looks no different whether is has been tapped once (= only the next character will be in upper-case) or twice (= caps lock is on). That's rather confusing at times. Other keyboards either display the up arrow in solid color when tapped, with a different color when caps lock is on, or (better, IMO) display a small horizontal line underneath the arrow when caps lock is on.

title: Allow plugin extension keyboards
body: Hi, is there a reason why plugin extension keyboards are not allowed or could this just be switched to true?

title: Capital umlauts not possible when using hardware keyboard
body: When using a bluetooth hardware keyboard it is not possible to type capital umlauts. (ÄÖÜ) Usually those character are typed by activating caps lock and then pressing the corresponding umlaut key. (KeyCodes 71,74,75) Could this be considered by AnySoftKeyboard?

title: After auto-picking suggestion, backspace (to re-edit the auto-picked suggestion) should disable auto-pick temporaly
label: [Label(name="bug")]

title: Unicode Emoticons for qick text
body:
Using Unicode Emoticons instead of the plain-text ones. This is useful for 4.4+ androids, since some apps (like text secure) disabled their own icon system in this case.

I really don't know, what this id-stuff in  res/xml/quick_text_keys.xml#22 means, I simply increased the number by 1.

title: Hide smiley key
body: As far as I can tell, there is not an option to hide the smiley key. For those of us who do not use this or other "quick texts", this key is annoying and taking up precious real estate. Can there be a setting added for he bottom bar that removes this?

title: issue in style.xml file for the items in the styles
body:
error: Error: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'iconKeyShift'.

code is as follows:

<style name="AnyKeyboardBaseKeyIconTheme">
        <!-- should support normal, android:state_pressed, feedback, android:state_pressed+feedback, android:state_checked, state_checked+feedback -->
        <item name="iconKeyShift">@drawable/dark_key_shift_set</item>
        <!-- should support normal, android:state_pressed, feedback, android:state_pressed+feedback, android:state_checked, state_checked+feedback -->
        <item name="iconKeyControl">@drawable/dark_key_control_set</item>
        <!-- should support normal, feedback -->
        <item name="iconKeyBackspace">@drawable/dark_key_delete_set</item>
        <!-- should support normal, feedback -->
        <item name="iconKeySpace">@drawable/dark_key_space_set</item>
        <!-- should support normal, feedback -->
        <item name="iconKeyTab">@drawable/dark_key_tab_set</item>
        <!-- should support normal, feedback -->
        <item name="iconKeyCancel">@drawable/dark_key_cancel_set</item>
        <!-- should support normal, feedback -->
        <item name="iconKeyGlobe">@drawable/dark_key_globe_set</item>
        <!-- should support normal, key_type_feedback, action_done, action_done+key_type_feedback, action_search, action_search+key_type_feedback, action_go, action_go+key_type_feedback  -->
        <item name="iconKeyAction">@drawable/dark_key_action_set</item>
        <!-- should support normal, feedback -->
        <item name="iconKeyMic">@drawable/dark_key_mic_set</item>
        <!-- should support normal, feedback -->
        <item name="iconKeySettings">@drawable/dark_key_settings_set</item>

        <!-- condensing icons -->
        <item name="iconKeyCondenseNormal">@drawable/ic_normal_keyboard</item>
        <item name="iconKeyCondenseSplit">@drawable/ic_split_keyboard</item>
        <item name="iconKeyCondenseCompactToRight">@drawable/ic_compact_right_keyboard</item>
        <item name="iconKeyCondenseCompactToLeft">@drawable/ic_compact_left_keyboard</item>
    </style>


![compilation_error_image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8642729/4136471/a2745e0c-337e-11e4-9dd1-824f33438445.jpg)

title: Hardcoded Package Name in Custom xml Namespace Vs res-auto
body:
Building a project flavor with different package name gives a bunch resource not found... error with the xml files because of the hard coded package name `xmlns:ask="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/com.menny.android.anysoftkeyboard"` in the custom xml namespace. Would be great if the hard coded package name is replaced with `res-auto` so it automatically uses the configured package names during the build process.

This will also open all sort of possibilities.

If you agree this is okay, I can send a pull request with a fix.

title: Displays ".. ." instead of "..."
body: It happens when you write a word, then press space and then 3 points (...) which written   (.. .). It happens also after the dictionary replaces words. It happens in Hebrew and English.

title: Czech layout is missing on F-Droid
body:
Hello,
I cannot find Czech layout on F-Droid for this totally awesome keyboard, could you please make sure it is there together with other language packs? I found it only at https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.herrlado.ask.languagepack.czech

Thank you!

title: Key repeat & czech letters
body:
Hello,
when using [Czech layout](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.herrlado.ask.languagepack.czech) with key repeat enabled, letters with diacritic marks are repeated. Fore example holding `i` will not create `iiiiiiiii` (expected), but `ííííííí` (wrong) instead. To get `ííííííí` i would like to one short tap followed by press and hold, because two short presses create `í`.

However, some letters can have more than one diacritic mark, for example `e` can have `é` or `ě`, and `u` can have `ú` or `ů`. So to get `ů` a tripple tap is required and for `ůůůůůůů` I would expect two short taps plus press and hold the third tap.

title: Telegram, black suggestion bar in landscape
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Sorry for my English.

Telegram with ASK in portrait works well:

![screenshot_2014-07-07-13-35-20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8089376/3494713/6347450e-05cb-11e4-9882-b260f737f0dc.png)

But in landscape there is a black bar instead suggestion bar.

![screenshot_2014-07-07-13-35-41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8089376/3494733/d4d43d62-05cb-11e4-8a6c-fa38fc4d709a.png)

This only fails with Telegram. Is there any workaround? Where is the problem, with Telegram or with ASK?

Thank you.

title: Merge Belarusian layout
body:
Please add Belarusian layouts (Cyrillic and Latin) from [alex73's repository](/alex73/AnySoftKeyboardLanguagePackBelarusian). They currently lack a dictionary, but it can be generated from `hunspell-be` package (the following is for Debian):

``` sh
apt-get install hunspell-be hunspell-tools
unmunch /usr/share/hunspell/be_BY.dic /usr/share/hunspell/be_BY.aff > be_BY.wordlist
```

title: Display language code, not the full name
body:
As can be seen from the attached screenshots, full language names can be way too long, so they can't be displayed in full on the button and become unreadable. It'd be much better if only the first words were displayed (followed by ‘…’) in that case, or, optionally, just the language code (be, en and so on).

label: [Label(name="enhancement")]

title: Feature request - full geometry and long-press alternate customization
body:
ASK is a PHENOMENAL keyboard software.  It does everything I need.  But I'd love for it to do everything I wanted as well.

I would like to be able to (for example) edit a text file and have this change the geometry of the keyboard layout, for example to make the spacebar comparatively taller than other keys, or to move keys all to one side, or to have more rows than ASK currently allows.  I don't require some graphical editor, but it sure would be cool to be able to edit.

I'd like to change the Dvorak keyboard, already excellent, to suit my preferences even more accurately!

Thanks for making an awesome product.

title: Built-in dictionary not being used
label: [Label(name="question"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body: I've had ASK installed for a year and I'm using the latest version now on various versions of Cyanogenmod 10. It never has identical suggestions as the AOSP keyboard, even though I have "Use fallback User-dictionary" unchecked. Now, I'm currently running AOSP keyboard from 4.4 with a modified package name, so I can't pin it down, but I still sure it's a problem.

title: Abbreviations dictionary should not be dependant on the master Suggestions switch
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]

title: Revert unwanted changes from Crowdin
body:
Please revert unwanted changes.
I will be updating the translation directly but with watching for suggestions from other translators (unlikely) at Crowdin.

title: jni code  in the repo
body:
I'm trying to build the app from source and I've got most of it worked out, except that the jni code doesn't build. There's something in temp_jni but I'm not sure what to do with it as it doesn't build.

Also you should have a settings.gradle with ASK-API and Frankenrobot (since there are no artifacts on maven central).

```
include ':AnySoftKeyboard-API'
project(':AnySoftKeyboard-API').projectDir = new File('/home/gerry/srclib/AnySoftKeyboard-API')
include ':FrankenRobot'
project(':FrankenRobot').projectDir = new File('/home/gerry/srclib/FrankenRobot')
```

and compile project(':Frankenrobot') in build.gradle.

Building the dictionary from source is now harder than it was when it was built into the build.xml, but not impossible.

title: Interacting AS-Keyboard with a hardware keyboard
body:
Menny,

for one of our Google TV project we want to interact your AnySoftKeyboard with a hardware keyboard connected via USB port. After investigation we still have some questions:
- Is it possible to handle the events from USB keyboard (for example, using D-pad arrows to move cursor?
- move the focus between input fields (especially, between edit text fields) ?
- do not hide the AnySoftKeyboard when connecting the hardware keyboard?

Thanks for your help!

title: (Restore Functionality): Show current language in the status bar
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="enhancement")]

title: Quickly pressing and releasing two fingers (somewhat sequencely) will cause a swipe triggered
label: [Label(name="Weird behavior")]

title: Displaying suggestions breaks the Android spell checking mechanism
body:
How to reproduce:
- Enable the suggestions in AnySoftKeyboard.
- Enable the Android spell checker.
- Type a word that is _not_ known by either the spell checker or by the keyboard so suggestions can be generated.
- Ignore the suggestion from the keyboard.
- The word will be underlined by the spell checker.
- When clicking on the word, the popup from the spell checker opens but closes immediately again, breaking the spell checking mechanism.

The popup displays fine when the suggestions are disabled in AnySoftKeyboard.

title: Newline send the SMS on 4.4 SMS app
body:
With 4.3 I can enter a newline, on 4.4 it sends the sms, I can only insert a newline with AOSP keyboard (tested with ASK and OpenWNN). The problem seems to happen only in SMS app.

Maybe the cause is some API change in 4.4? I use the Fdroid build (which is not the last one), so maybe it works with the last release…

title: Problem when typing
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
Sometimes when I type, The keyboard rips in half, and does not let me type anything else until I change to the stock keyboard and then again to AsK. Is someone else having this problem? I have taken a _bad quality_ images (because anytime I try to sceencap it, the keyboard disappears) of my problem I hope it helps. 

More info:
CM 7 on rooted Nexus One.
The event happens randomly. I can't make it happen at will.
I use v120.1.2.20131226 with Dvorak/Colemak layout, no additional dictionaries or skins. 
If this is happening and I tap on a letter, then the "two pieces" of the keyboard get together again, but still can't type anything

I hope I can fix it because it is the best dvorak keyboard on the market but this is getting more and more annoying. I tried unistalling and reinstalling, rebooting, and some others.
![img0001](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6342842/1862927/6f0b6512-77d9-11e3-9a82-898c7ce1071e.jpg)
![img0000](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6342842/1862928/73b05816-77d9-11e3-8046-62af6640184e.jpg)

title: Keyboard randomly disappears
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Click a "writable" section on your phone (e.g. to answer a message)
2. Start writing as usual
3. Keyboard disappears and you have to click on the "writable" zone again.

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
I'm expecting the keyboard to stay there until I'm done writing.

What version of the product are you using? On what operating system?
1.2.20131217 (v117) - Android 4.1.2 (Galaxy S3)

title: Create a new external Gingerbread theme

title: Refactor the API styleables
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: In the wake of https://github.com/AnySoftKeyboard/AnySoftKeyboard/issues/266, it seems that we have many duplicates, and many late initializations in the API lib. Since we now have backward compatibility in place, there is no need for all this mess in the API lib.

title: tips feedback fragment does not change setting
Phablet Mode - Allow condensing the keyboard to one of the edges.
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
UX:
Swipe with two fingers from left-to-right will condense keys to the right edge.
Swipe with two fingers from right-to-left will condense keys to the left edge.

Specs:
Condensing factor should be the same as the split condensing factor.

The gesture should be configurable.

title: Setup wizard: when AnySoftKeyboard is selected as the default keyboard, get back the App
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="enhancement")]

title: Feature request: abbreviation support
body:
In addition to or as an extension of the existing words table it would be nice to be able to specify abbreviations or substitutions to be made upon hitting the space bar. Some people might use it for shorthand, for example. But actually my interest is for partial on-the-fly reverse transliteration. 

My son is starting to use his phone and a Bluetooth keyboard to take notes in his talmud class. He types much faster in English than in Hebrew, not to mention getting used to the idea of switching the keyboard layout back and forth -- although ASK makes it fairly easy, it still would slow him down to switch back and forth regularly to enter a few Hebrew words here and there in his mostly English notes. So it would be nice if he could configure ASK to insert "גמרא" when he types "gemara", "רש"י" when he types "rashi", etc.

title: Usability of long-press for numbers needs improvement
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: Top row support for numbers on long-press used to work better. Now for some of the letters on the top row, the number is not the default long-press selection. This hinders usability. I almost never use the non-English latin characters, so it would be nice to be able to turn them off -- but anyway it seems the number should be the default selection and the one that shows on the keyboard in the long-press hint area.

title: Issue #236. Added scroll container to all tips, and added divider to sep...
body: ...arate between the tip content and layout actions

title: a bunch of stuff for release v114
Tips layout should have top and bottom shadows to hint the user about title/bottom actions and scroll-ability
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]

title: Support email (for crashes) should be configured in the Gradle build
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It should not be part of the resource.

It can be done with this: https://plus.google.com/100465343617945336905/posts/jBh6rRtSrtW

title: Add Click state to various buttons and clickables in the app
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="enhancement")]

title: Additional Licenses Information is missing
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: The latest version uses several 3rd party libraries. The app should include the "Additional licenses" page.

title: Allow inline editing of a word in User Words Editor
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]

title: updating build tools and support libraries
limiting the max API to 6. Target is 4.
Hide Keyboard on physical key not working
body:
This option is not working - with either enable or disable when a keyboard is attached the soft keyboard is never displayed.
Tested with Nexus 7 (2012) with an OTG usb cable, a Xperia Ray with a mini usb male to usb A female adapter and an Accuative VIP 5000 (it has an USB port).
If you don't have a tablet with a usb port or adapters for it you can test this by installing a VNC server (droid server for instance), it will add a "physical" keyboard.

title: Various commits for milestone 112-114.
body:
Including backward/forward AddOn API compatibility (issue #221). 
Lots of refactors for issue #222.
Moving to Gradle build system (issue #223).
Word Editor actions are in the Actionbar (issue #215)
Revisit the empty state in the words editor (issue #216)

title: Better backward and forward AddOn API compatibility
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]

title: Better support for backward and forward add-on API support
Slovak layout should be QWERTZ
body:
Hi,

I am trying the keyboard with Slovak layout, but it is only qwerty, not QWERTZ as it should be. How can I correct it, pls?
Thanks.

title: Undo a suggestion with backspace and move along.
body:
When I type in a word that is not in the dictionary and then hit "space" or "comma" or "period", etc. the word is replaced with a suggestion. "Backspace" undoes the replacement but, it also removes the last typed character and typing the "space" (or a punctuation) second time replaces the word again. I propose to change this behavior to:

If the last action was to replace the word with a suggestion from a dictionary then Backspace only undoes the replacement but doesn't delete the last typed whitespace or a punctuation character. To actually delete the last typed character (the whitespace or the punctuation) and return to suggestions mode the Backspace needs to be tapped again.

Thank you.

title: Words Editor - empty state
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: When the words list is empty, show a bit "Click to create your first word", with a big + icon.

title: Add ActionBar to Words Editor instead of the bottom action bar
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]

title: Add New Word row inlined with the Words list
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Instead of the action icon at the bottom. The "add" action should still exists in the ActionBar.

title: List->Grid in WordsEditor (responsive design)
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
On phones it should be a list (showing the word, and action icons). Clicking should open an edit dialog for editing the word and its frequency.

On Tablets (7"+) a grid should be used (showing the word, its frequency and action icons). Editing should be allowed directly using the grid.

title: [FR] Gesture input (aka swype)
body: Please add this feature.

title: Add RS sign to currency
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_rupee_sign

title: fix for OutOfBound exception in copyarray - v108
API3 specific support
body:
This branch is targeted at API3 devices only.
Having this branch will allow ASK to add the Support-Library into the project, and develop in a more modern way.

title: Key preview position is not always consistent between devices and themes
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I'm the maintainer of the Hungarian layout and with recent versions I got bug reports, that long presses on some buttons result in an incorrect behavior. As it turns out key 'U' for example is on the 4th column from the right and moreover the Hungarian layout provides a 4 key popup window for this key (uűüú). The default letter for the long press is actually the letter in the popup appearing right above the U key. Now the problem is that the popup is sometimes right aligned, but sometimes left aligned so I cannot create a layout that is consistent on each devices. On some devices with high resolution the popup is aligned on the right while on lower res devices on the right. You can see the same effect on the same device using default and a glow dark theme. (it seems that the padding of popup in glow dark is smaller resulting in a different layout).

This issue was probably introduced because of added padding in the popup layout. (which is fine, but should be made consistent)

title: A lot of work toward v106, including (but not limited to) test project
One Hand mode
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: In _one hand_ mode, the key size will not be calculated as percentage of the screen width, but by a constant value (say 360dp? Don't know), and the user will be able to select to which screen edge the keyboard is locked to.

title: Performance improvement suggestion
Autocomplete overlaps keyboard when using down arrow
body:
When autocomplete drop-down opens, pressing down arrow to move autocomplete selection makes autocomplete drop-down overlap keyboard.

Reproducible using Google Play. Android version 4.0.3.

title: Blank hint (autocorrect) buttons
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When I type, I can't see what is displayed in the autocorrect suggestions (cf. attached screenshot), which makes ASK pretty much unusable without deactivating entirely autocorrect. This bug might be related to #176. Changing the keymap doesn't resolve it.

ASK 20130528 from F-droid on CyanogenMod 10.1-20130411.

![screenshot_2013-06-06-13-38-33](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4635929/628046/48b11a48-d076-11e2-890b-6cca55b34adc.png)

title: Blank buttons in the smiley selector
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
First reported in #154, sorry for the mess.

Here is a screenshot taken while pressing the smiley button. It shows that some of the buttons are unlabelled (but still type something when I select them, for examble the bottom-left button types ":-("). I have this problem only for the smileys, and changing the keymap doesn't change anything (tried English-symbols, French AZERTY and French Bépo).

I'm using ASK 20130528 from F-droid on CyanogenMod 10.1-20130411.

![screenshot_2013-06-06-13-37-47-1284080463](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4635929/621772/dd4880b2-cf16-11e2-8a72-cfc5729b8ff4.png)

title: Auto-Correction popup text sometimes changes in mid-animation
Many fixes related to the v101 milestone
CapsLock on physical keyboard doesn't work
body:
Asus Transformer TF300, Android 4.2.1.
CapsLock on physical keyboard has absolutely no effect.

title: Option to disable key preview via <Key tag
body: Related to: https://github.com/AnySoftKeyboard/AnySoftKeyboard/issues/151

title: Update the strip of suggestions when the keyboard change
body: When keyboard change, the strip of suggestions is not updated. I think this fix the issue.

title: Smart deletion of backword with new KeyCode -14 Edit
body: Related to this issue AnySoftKeyboard/AnySoftKeyboard#153

title: When typing really fast, autotext is late to the party of "pickDefaultSuggestion"
body:
Autotext suggest a correction and is picked if _displayed_ when pressing space. But in real usage, if you type really fast, the autotext is not _displayed_ and when pressing space, the best _match_ (aka getPreferredWord) is different than the autocorrection.. (defeating the purpose of autotext)

For example... with default installation if you type "aber" it will suggest "ages". If you type "aber" really fast, a lot of times.. (as in real usage) you will be able to _commit_ "aber" and autotext will miss the correction..

I _think_ this fix it, as I'm unable to type "aber" because is always autocorrected to my setting.

title: Autotext Improvements and patricia tries adition
body:
Hello, Not sure where to start..

This  is first commit about language related improvements. I love the customization options this keyboard provides, but the language features had some limitations, I would like to work into this, because I wish to have a great word dictionary/prediction/suggestion/etc.

This commit, improves AutoText feature, and there is room for more.
- Custom tries where replaced with https://code.google.com/p/concurrent-trees/ , because the previous version was having some size limitations, and also was missing some words, concurrent-trees is a robust solution, full featured.
- Generated trees are cached to disk in serialized forms (if available) /data/AnySoftKeyboard/AutoText ( example /data/AnySoftKeyboard/AutoText/en.serialized )
- Trees are generated in background, and will become available when these are processed.

TODO:
- when the application/service loads (starts), it should load to memory the most used generated trees.
- tree generation and serialization should be performed on add-on installation and not the first time you load open the keyboard/switch dictionaries.
- there is a need to remove/clean, serialized versions when some new _addon_ is installed.

Improvements over previous version:
- better and robust handling of words in trees
- no size limits
- faster loading and switching (specially with big auto-text files)
- tree caching

I still need to investigate how the other parts related to language works..

body:
For some reason I'm unable to add a symbols.xml keyboard.. I'm not sure, if I'm doing correctly, I just created a very simple <Keyboard and located the XML file in res/xml/symbols.xml  B-)

Looking at the code, it seems, there is possibility to create the following keyboards:

```
symbols
```

title: 'undo deleted'
body:
Yep!

I imagine to have an "undo" command.. but, something _very simple_ as: 
- If the last pushed key was "delete"(the command)
- the keyboard can have _somewhere_, the deleted text.
- then, a command "undo delete" is available, 
- if the user presses "undo deleted", the text is restored.
- if instead, the user presses any other key after deleting, the undo history is just trashed.

Just an idea, which _looks like_ simple and useful

title: Blank "Key preview" for some keys
body:
Currently, the "Key preview", of some characters are just "blank". Not sure if I'm doing something wrong.

For example arrows ↑  and ↓ correctly show ↑  and ↓ as "key preview", respectively, when long-pressed and repeatable = true, like this:

```
<Key android:keyHeight="@integer/key_short_height" android:keyWidth="12.5%p" ask:isFunctional="true" android:codes="@integer/key_code_arrow_up" android:isRepeatable="true" android:keyEdgeFlags="left" ask:hintLabel=" " android:popupCharacters=""/>
        <Key android:keyHeight="@integer/key_short_height" android:keyWidth="12.5%p" ask:isFunctional="true" android:codes="@integer/key_code_arrow_down" android:isRepeatable="true" android:popupCharacters="" ask:hintLabel=" "/>
```

but with the same configuration, with keys  ← and →, it shows a completely black "key preview". Sometimes, the "key preview" shows correct for some ms, but these get black quickly.

```
<Key android:keyHeight="@integer/key_short_height" android:keyWidth="12.5%p" ask:isFunctional="true" android:codes="@integer/key_code_arrow_left" android:isRepeatable="true" android:popupCharacters="" ask:hintLabel=" "/>
        <Key android:keyHeight="@integer/key_short_height" android:keyWidth="12.5%p" ask:isFunctional="true" android:codes="@integer/key_code_arrow_right" android:isRepeatable="true" android:popupCharacters="" ask:hintLabel=""/>
```

Something similar happens with some other keys, such ",.?!", when you hit these quickly. ( I have some vague suspicious that this happens, when a hit of these keys cause a change of caps(visual change caps in all the keyboard), for example, moving the cursor(with right and left arrows) inside this text: " . . . . . . . . . ")

title: Back-word feature should remove some previous whitespace and room for improvements.
body:
I'm currently creating a custom layout for my language, and the key "delete" defaults to delete "backword" (because I prefer this way). like this:

```
<Key android:codes="-7" android:isRepeatable="true" android:keyEdgeFlags="right" ask:hintLabel=" " android:popupCharacters="" android:keyIcon="@drawable/sym_keyboard_delete"  android:keyWidth="15%p"  ask:isFunctional="true"/>
```

I think this function(delete back-word) can be improved to provide what it seems a useful  behaviour. Currently it seems, it only delete the previous word, and non-words are deleted char by char.

Suggestions:

**1.**
When the previous characters are just "whitepspace" remove all the whitespaces till the first non-whitespace char.

For example this: 

```
and some words.    |
```

 will become this:

`and some words.|`

**1.1** 
An exception when there is newline characters:

```
and something.
        |
```

will become

```
and something.
|
```

**2** 
First hit to delete "back-word" should remove just the previous char. _this allow corrections of the last typed char(when we notice we made an spelling)_. Next hits should remove whole words.
For example:

```
and I made a typi|
```

will become 

```
and I made a typ|
```

then, if I hit delete again(or If I keep pressed the "delete" key), should become:

```
and I made a |
```

**3** 

A timeout, to allow _char by char_ deletion. similar to previous suggestion, if I hit "delete backword", then wait a little bit (good idea to have it configurable via preferences, such 120ms), the next hit to "delete backword" will delete just 1 char.

For example:

```
and some text|
```

will become

```
and some tex|
```

wait 190ms, hit again "delete backword" will become

```
and some te|
```

etc..

I run out of imagination with this function.. for now :)

title: Customizable hint colour and probably some other theme settings via preferences.
body:
It would be nice, to have some control over themes, via preferences. Such colours, margins.. font-size, etc. Very minimal... but the most important thing, (happened to me with other popular keyboards too) is the colour of the "hints". With this keyboard and theme "Plain dark theme", the hints are almost invisible, not only colour, font-size too.

Screenshot:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9303546/AnySoftKeyboard/Screenshot_2013-05-14-07-25-45.png

title: Disable the key preview: that a key shows when pressing or keeping pressed.
body:
I would like to completely disable the _key preview_ via an attribute to the <Key tag.

Very minimal but I found the popup distracting, when for example, [space] has no especial function and keeping the key pressed just insert spaces, in repetitive manner. Same with "delete" key.

I guess something like:

```
<Key... android/ask:previewDisabled="true"/>
```

Thanks!

body:
(Minimal)

Talking about a <keyboard tag (and its contents) I would like to have a special margin between the suggestions and the keyboard. My finger, sometimes hit the suggestion instead of 'qwertyuiop..' 

Also, a special margin between two rows.. for example, I would like to configure the last row to be more close to the previous row. Not sure if this can be done with some existent attribute.

Ah! also...(sorry, to many questions) I would like to make the keyboard narrow in landscape, for example to cover the 75% of the screen, instead of full the width...
Thanks!

Any hint how to do this? Thanks in advance.

I think a complete <row maybe hidden/shown based on orientation, but also keys probably would be useful.

title: Physical translation for a digit as targetChar with shiftModifier
body:
In physical keyboard file
1. targetChar is a digit
2. shiftModifier = "true"

In URL mode, if the key is pressed with shift, instead of the digit, the character corresponding to the digit shifted on QUERTY keyboard is printed.

For example, in the case of
shiftModifier="true" targetChar="1"
If the key is pressed with shift in URL mode (browser), "!" appears instead of "1".

In the case of
shiftModifier="true" targetChar="2"
If the key is pressed with shift, "@" appears instead of "2".

And so on.

Reproduced on Asus TF300T, Android 4.2.1.

title: Sometimes pressing space erases word. Isn't always reproducible but have videos of two instances
body:
To reproduce

1) Type: Only call if there is a problem
2) Scroll up or select just after the word call
3) Press spacebar
4) Either it will add a space or destroy the word and add a period after Only
5) If you cannot reproduce add spaces/backspaces or another instance of the word problem after the first instance and try the same thing with call.

I haven't been able to exactly identify what is going on yet to get it into the state of reproducibility but maybe I will try some more tomorrow.

Here are the two videos: 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B79_OGndP8E
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-XlcV8BSq30

title: configuration is lost from time to time
body:
I don't want suggestions, so I disable them. But from time to time, this option re-enables itself and I have to disable it manually again.

Usually (not sure if always), when this happens I also receive a notification with details of the program such as the version, as if it had been updated or installed itself anew. But this happens much more often than there is a new release.

I installed this app through F-Droid.

title: apostrophe disappeared in URL mode.
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The bottom row has just had some changes (maybe after #76?) and now the apostrophe is gone.
I cannot find it anywhere, in any of my three installed languages nor in any mode.
Even if it's still somewhere else (but I think it isn't), it's way too hidden.

title: Additional accent characters in English layout
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
For "A": Ă, ă, Â, â
For "I": Î, î
For "S": Ș, ș
For "T": Ț, ț

title: Release tags
body: Release tags would be helpful for knowing which commit to build from. Separately, there has been a version 20130429-2-skinny-eye-candy-for-my-birthday/97 published to Google Play but it doesn't exist here yet.

title: Stress marks for Ukrainian keyboard
body:
It would be nice if it were possible to input stress marks on vowels using the Ukrainian keyboard. Stress marks are not used in normal text, but only in dictionaries and books for children/learners, me being in the latter category.

For each of the letters Е, Ї, І, А, О, Є, Я, И and Ю, there should be a popup that lets you input the corresponding letter plus U+0301, a combining acute accent.

I would have tried doing it myself, but I couldn't find the files for the Ukrainian language pack. Are they on Github somewhere?

title: Popup Chars show up when clicking two keys same time.
body: `KeyDown A` `KeyDown B` `KeyUp A` `KeyUp B` - this combination should just type "AB", but it causes B's popup chars to show up until you press somewhere outside. If the second key does not have any popup char, then it stucks in pressed mode. Really uncomfortable when you're typing fast.

TAGS:release-keys
VERSION.INCREMENTAL:DXKT5
VERSION.RELEASE:4.0.3
VERSION.SDK_INT:10
That's all I know.

---

*****\* Logcat:
Not supported at the moment

Sent from Samsung Mobile

title: Issues with typing in Opera Mini
label: [Label(name="bug")]

title: Do not auto-popup on-screen keyboard if usb/bluetooth keyboard is connected
body: On-screen keyboard pops up each time text-editable element is focused, but when hardware keyboard is open or usb/bluetooth keyboard is connected, it annoys hell out of me (I think most users will agree). Yes when I press a key on hardware keyboard ASK on-screen keyboard does go away due to the tweak available in Settings, but why should it pop up at all? Okay there are uses for that, I imagine, let it be the default option, but at least give users an option to disable on-screen keyboard at all when hardware kb is present.

title: Add option to change layout-switch shortcut
body: Many people use bluetooth keyboards with their android devices (as do I). Some of us need more than one layout and ASK is the best keyboard for this (in my opinion at least). Current shortcut (shift+space) to change layout is counterintuitive for any person used to hardware keyboards. Can you please add the option to select another shortcut (preferably customizable) e.g. on my PC I use Shift+CapsLock (which also isn't a standard, I know), but at least addition of Ctrl+Shift and Alt+Shift options is a must.

title: Disappearing lang-switch keys text
body:
https://code.google.com/p/softkeyboard/issues/detail?id=1054

1.install
2.go to Settings->Tweaks (no need to change anything to reproduce the issue)
3.type some text in an app

What disappears:
- top row button captions
- suggestions (the worst issue of them all)
- Home and End buttons on the utility keyboard
- button to switch to additional symbols keyboards
- all text based smileys (in long press menu)

title: french dictionnary (apostrophe case)
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
https://code.google.com/p/softkeyboard/issues/detail?id=573

The comment #7 explain everything : the apostrophe and hyphen should be concider as a normal word separator.

title: New Hebrew physical translation file
body:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<!--
 QwertyTranslation := specify the characters which are mapped from the English chars to your desired chars.
 QWERTYUIOPASDFGHJKLZXCVBNM
 -->
<PhysicalTranslation QwertyTranslation="/'קראטוןםפשדגכעיחלךזסבהנמצ">
    <!-- SequenceMapping
        keySequence := keycode value (as defined in KeyEvent class) to be mapped to a real unicode character
        this can be multiple keystrokes.
      -->
    <SequenceMapping keySequence="68" targetChar="ת" />
    <SequenceMapping keySequence="68" altModifier="true" targetChar="\u003F" />
    <SequenceMapping keySequence="68" shiftModifier="true" targetChar="\u0021" />
    <SequenceMapping keySequence="75" targetChar="ף" />
    <SequenceMapping keySequence="75" targetChar="ף" />
    <SequenceMapping keySequence="95" targetChar="ץ" />
    <SequenceMapping keySequence="29" altModifier="true" targetChar="₪" />
</PhysicalTranslation>
```

title: Some questions about building dictionaries
body:
As you may know, f-droid.org distributes this app which it builds from source. We don't build language packs but recommend people to build themselves or download via code.google.com. Now the script for creating dictionaries is only in the source code there. It's only visible by direct link and requires the xml dictionary to be in dict and not in e.g. en/. I can't find it in AnySoftKeyboard-Tools on github.com: is there a reason for this? Anyway I have built something called res/raw/words_1.dict which I assume is OK. 

Also, is it ok to delete keyboard_keystore?

title: Show unicode characters by default for arrows keys instead of icons
body:
Previous versions of ASK used Unicode arrow characters for arrow keys by default. I think they're much more cute than current gingerbread-like rounded icons. And the main problem is that now no theme can return to the old look and use characters again, because the code takes that icons as a default!
The issue was previously here: http://code.google.com/p/softkeyboard/issues/detail?id=984
Now I've rebased it against your new version.
Also it changes fallbackIconSetStyleId from fallbackTheme.getIconsThemeResId() (which is the default theme id) to just hardcoded R.style.AnyKeyboardBaseKeyIconTheme.
I assume it's more correct because in theory any theme may be selected as default, and for example if you'll select gingerbread one, with previous code you'll again lose the ability to return back to unicode arrows.

So please review and merge this change! :-)

title: Keyboard switches back to QWERTY Latin in Firefox address bar
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
From Mozilla bug 802975 (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=802975),
1. Enable the "QWERTY Latin keyboard" and another keyboard (e.g. Hebrew keyboard)
2. Open the Firefox address bar
3. Switch to Hebrew keyboard
4. Enter a Hebrew character

The keyboard is switched back to QWERTY Latin keyboard.

This occurs because after entering the first character, Firefox calls InputMethodManager.restartInput() to change the keyboard action from "go" to "search". However,  AnySoftKeyboard switches back to QWERTY when restarting. This does not happen with the Android keyboard. This also seems to not happen when the "QWERTY Latin keyboard" is disabled. Thanks for looking into the issue!

title: Word Suggestion for Devanagari.
body: I think I have seen somewhere that the word suggestion doesent work after the use of symbols but this is problem for Devanagari Languages like Nepali, Hindi etc.  because the symbols (we call it Matra) are part of the word in those language. I have made a devanagari keyboard layout and a Nepali Dictionary based on AnySoftKeyboard but the suggestion doesnt work because we use devanagari symbols and the word suggestion doesnt after that. I hope you can understand the problem and provide option to break or restart word suggestion only after space key.

title: Russian key layout which uses long-press
body:
I've made a Russian key layout for AnySoftKeyboard, where keys are not so tightly packed as in the default layout, less used keys are invoked with long-press. The 27-key layout has the same button size as the English key layout, and the 25-key layout is for budget phones with tiny screens, which are quite popular where I live.
It would be nice to merge this thing into the Russian language pack, however it's not inside Git - I've found it at the old SVN:
http://code.google.com/p/softkeyboard/source/browse/trunk/LanguagePacks/
but it's kind of outdated.
So I've modified the LanguagePack project from Git:
https://github.com/pelya/AnySoftKeyboard-LanguagePack-Russian-bigkeys

The APK file to test, it does not contain a dictionary:
https://github.com/downloads/pelya/AnySoftKeyboard-LanguagePack-Russian-bigkeys/ASK_Russian_bigkeys.apk

If you'll be merging it into the old language pack, you only need to copy these files:
https://github.com/pelya/AnySoftKeyboard-LanguagePack-Russian-bigkeys/blob/Russian-bigkeys/res/xml/keyboards.xml
https://github.com/pelya/AnySoftKeyboard-LanguagePack-Russian-bigkeys/blob/Russian-bigkeys/res/xml/russian25.xml
https://github.com/pelya/AnySoftKeyboard-LanguagePack-Russian-bigkeys/blob/Russian-bigkeys/res/xml/russian27.xml
https://github.com/pelya/AnySoftKeyboard-LanguagePack-Russian-bigkeys/blob/Russian-bigkeys/res/values/strings.xml
https://github.com/pelya/AnySoftKeyboard-LanguagePack-Russian-bigkeys/blob/Russian-bigkeys/res/values-ru/strings.xml
If that's too bothersome to you, I'll just release my own apk file to the Android Market/Google Play.

The current git head (commit ee7b5545bb282a3180efec797e01aa57f531b2cd) crashes when long-pressing any button (except return) on the keyboard. See trace at https://gist.github.com/3751016

v76 from Google Code worked fine.

title: support for hintLabel
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: http://code.google.com/p/softkeyboard/issues/detail?id=968

title: "revert default pick" fix
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: It was long, and hard, but the issue is resolved (and has less code than before)

title: False suggestion restart upon backspace after auto-pick
body:
1. create a new mail message in gmail app, and enter the Message text-box
2. write a word, and press ENTER. Make sure there is a space at the end of the line.
3. write another word (different from the last word you typed), but with a typo, so when you press SPACE, the correct word is auto-picked.
4. move the cursor back to the line above, by thumb moving. The cursor should be located at the end of the first row, after the space.
5. press backspace.

The word will be replaced with the word in the second line.

title: Suggestions interfere with address input in CycleStreets app
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
http://code.google.com/p/softkeyboard/issues/detail?id=971
1. Download an install http://www.jezuk.co.uk/cyclestreets/jezhiggins/CycleStreets-latest.apk
2. Open the app press menu -> Plan a route
3. Enter UK post codes in start and end points, i.e. EC2A 4HJ and W2 5UH (with space)
4. Pick the address from the auto-complete suggestion (in looks like a dropdown list, below the input text box).
5. Click Find Route

It will ask you to select an address, rather than just use the UK postcode.
